tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V1.56.22 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright returns with the consumer rights show, beginning with reports on counterfeit lifesaving equipment and fake cashmere being sold online.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin assess a Victorian flat in Brixton, London, a former pub in Crumlin, Caerphilly and a flat in Telford, Shropshire.

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with Richele Barker and her mother Lorraine to see whether they decided on a move to New Zealand after spending a week in Auckland two years ago.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives uncover a tale of adoption, the workhouse and illegitimacy while investigating the history of a quiet man in St Albans, and a letter from the Queen found in a derelict home in Kent leads them to the closely knit deaf community of the late 19th century.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Caroline Hawley join two teams to compete at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire, before selling their purchases at auction. Tim Wonnacott visits the Royal Artillery Museum in London, where he discovers items that once belonged to famous wartime figures.

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Davey Webb is caught between Laser and the law, while James bends rules to help. Adrijan is unusually aggressive and Angela hopes for a romantic evening.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Witley to save three more items destined for the trash, including copper pipes, which give Josh and Oli a headache, and some old floor boards.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank.

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team are in Sheffield, where Thomas Plant is taken by a set of watercolours and James Lewis finds a Victorian automaton that causes a stir in the auction.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: Bill Paterson narrates highlights of the event held on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle, with this year's edition marking the Queen's 90th birthday. Those taking part include the Nepal Army Band, the Band of Her Majesty's Royal Marines, the Jordanian Royal Guard, Band and Drill Team, the Locheil Marching Drill Team, the New Zealand Army Band and the Band and Drill Team of the King of Norway's Guard as well as the Massed Pipes and Drums, the Tattoo Highland Dancers and the Imps Motorcycle Display Team.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise grows suspicious of Ben's behaviour, Bex seeks advice from Stacey, and Steven is frustrated when Lauren buys a laptop to help her pitch for new business, despite the financial difficulties at Beale's continuing to grow.

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: Premiere. The alien thunder god returns to Earth when a powerful weapon from the dawn of time is discovered. The device attracts the attention of an old enemy of his people, who intends to use it to plunge the universe into darkness - and to stop him, Thor must form an uneasy alliance with his treacherous brother Loki. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.

programme.title: Class of 92: Out of Their League
programme.sub-title: Class of 92: Still Out of Their League.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary following Salford City FC returns, as the semi-professional football club owned by former Manchester United stars Ryan Giggs, Gary and Phil Neville, Paul Scholes and Nicky Butt try to win back-to-back promotions. The squad begin their first-ever season in the Northern Premier League Premier Division, three levels below league football and six steps below the Premier League, but it soon becomes clear that life in a higher tier might not be a fairytale story, despite a thrilling run in the FA Cup.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall guest-hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Tonight he introduces routines by Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright presents the consumer show, investigating counterfeit mattresses being sold across the UK and fake laser pens that caused permanent damage to a child's eye.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties in Croydon, Oldham and Wolstanton in Staffordshire, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: In 2009, sports teacher Alan Cappleman was desperate to start a new life in Australia, but wife Louise, however, did not share his vision. This edition catches up with them.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The pressure is on as the firms search for heirs on a case worth close to £500,000, while in Shropshire, the hunt is on for heirs to a career soldier's estate.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams visit an antiques fair in Newark, Nottinghamshire, to search for items to sell at auction, with Chris Gower and Anita Manning on hand to provide guidance. Tim Wonnacott also offers tips on spotting bargain jewellery.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: It is the day of the annual Summer Fayre and Mrs Tembe has everything carefully planned.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: The Kieleys receive an unpleasant update on the case against Michael Hennessy, while Claire and James clash over Davey as his family suffers the consequences.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple with a budget of £450,000 look for their first home together, complete with business potential, in North Yorkshire. Plus, he learns about the art of ploughing from a six nations champion.(n)

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team heads to Tatton Park in Cheshire, where Mark Stacey values a French wax doll and Anita Manning examines a Victorian brooch, which she hopes will entice collectors at auction in Liverpool. Elsewhere, Paul Martin explores the collections amassed in Tatton Hall by its last owner Maurice Egerton.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Courtney is worried to hear Louise has called the police and Carmel encourages Denise to arrange a doctor's appointment, but is frustrated when she continues to help Kim prepare for the show instead. Stacey realises all is not well with Sonia and the pair have a heart-to-heart, while Dot receives an upsetting letter.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Fletch struggles to treat a patient under police escort, but when they make a desperate dash to escape, Bernie and Serena rush to deal with an unfolding tragedy and a personal crisis of their own. Meanwhile, a troubled Morven seeks solace in charity work at a homeless shelter. However, the respite doesn't last long when Jasmine and Bernie's son, Cameron, encourage her to join them on a night out with Jez and Iain, from the hospital's Casualty Department.(n)

programme.title: One of Us
programme.desc: The Elliots and Douglases decide to cover up Lee's murder when the police come knocking, while Juliet's actions have tragic and unexpected consequences. Bill and Moira turn on each other after lying to protect their son, and after confessing all to his partner, Peter decides to make an important journey. Drama set in the remote Scottish Highland village of Braeston, focusing on the aftermath when two childhood sweethearts are killed on their return from honeymoon. Starring Juliet Stevenson, Joanna Vanderham, John Lynch, Julie Graham and Joe Dempsie.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: Sex in Strange Places.
programme.desc: New series. The presenter travels the globe to meet young people using their sexuality to make a living. She begins her journey in Turkey, where prostitution is legal and state-sponsored brothels exist. She meets sex workers who regard themselves as tutors to the uninitiated men of a sexually repressed society, preparing them for marriage.(n)

programme.title: Drugs Map of Britain
programme.desc: New series. Exploring drugs of choice in different parts of the UK, beginning with Wolverhampton. Cameras follow 27 year old Liam over three months in his battle to quit the synthetic cannabinoid `Black Mamba'.(n)

programme.title: Keepin 'er Country
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Allingham Arms Hotel in Bundoran, Co Donegal, which hosts traditional Irish and country music entertainers nightly throughout the summer season.(n)

programme.title: Pop Goes Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look back at key years in the province's history, soundtracked by chart hits from the time. The series begins by returning to 1969, the time of civil rights marches and the outbreak of the Troubles.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: Sex in Strange Places.
programme.desc: New series. The presenter travels the globe to meet young people using their sexuality to make a living. She meets sex workers who regard themselves as tutors to the uninitiated men of a sexually repressed society, preparing them for marriage.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Connections
programme.desc: The story behind department store-based sitcom Are You Being Served? The show's stars, including Mollie Sugden, Frank Thornton, Wendy Richard and John Inman, reveal how actress Joanna Lumley and a Piccadilly shop inspired writers David Croft and Jeremy Lloyd to pen the series. The reasons why the programme has remained immensely popular through the years are also examined.

programme.title: Comedy Connections
programme.desc: The story behind prison-based sitcom Porridge, and a chance to discover which actor was originally earmarked for the part of Godber. The programme reveals how the series was conceived and features contributions by Dick Clement, Ian La Frenais and Ronnie Barker himself.

programme.title: Scotland at the Games
programme.desc: A review of Scotland's contribution to Team GB's success at Rio 2016, the best-ever performance at an Olympics on foreign soil, which saw the likes of Callum Skinner, Katie Archibald, Andy Murray and Heather Stanning win gold medals.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels the country to trace the changes that have taken place since the birth of Scottish tourism two centuries ago. Using a variety of unusual means of transport, including a Victorian tricycle and a Shetland pony, he visits an array of unspoilt destinations and learns about the richness of the local landscape.

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: Bill Paterson narrates highlights of the event held on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle, with this year's edition marking the Queen's 90th birthday. Those taking part include the Nepal Army Band, the Band of Her Majesty's Royal Marines, the Jordanian Royal Guard, Band and Drill Team, the Locheil Marching Drill Team, the New Zealand Army Band and the Band and Drill Team of the King of Norway's Guard as well as the Massed Pipes and Drums, the Tattoo Highland Dancers and the Imps Motorcycle Display Team.

Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.

programme.title: The Supreme Sacrifice
programme.desc: Documentary examining how, in 1914, the British public demanded that the professional football season be suspended so players could fight in the war. At the time, the Heart of Midlothian squad were enjoying a spectacular run of success, and had recently made their mark as the best side in the country, but were put under extreme pressure to sign up for service. Eleven members of the team enlisted, and a number of them were subsequently killed in the Battle of the Somme. Narrated by Ken Stott, the programme features archive footage and veterans' memoirs, alongside contributions by historian Jack Alexander - who campaigned for a memorial to be erected on the battlefield.

Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.

programme.title: Rob Brydon at 50
programme.desc: Welsh comedian, actor and presenter Rob Brydon retraces his rocky road to success, from his early days in Porthcawl to the bright lights of Hollywood. The programme features a host of famous friends who joined Rob on his journey, including Tom Jones, Steve Coogan, Ruth Jones and David Walliams.

programme.title: Class of 92: Out of Their League
programme.sub-title: Class of 92: Still Out of Their League.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary following Salford City FC returns, as the semi-professional football club owned by former Manchester United stars Ryan Giggs, Gary and Phil Neville, Paul Scholes and Nicky Butt try to win back-to-back promotions. The squad begin their first-ever season in the Northern Premier League Premier Division, three levels below league football and six steps below the Premier League, but it soon becomes clear that life in a higher tier might not be a fairytale story, despite a thrilling run in the FA Cup.

programme.title: Coco Chanel & Igor Stravinsky
programme.desc: Fact-based drama examining the relationship between the fashion designer and the composer. Chanel is one of the few supporters of Stravinsky's controversial ballet The Rite of Spring, and when he is left penniless by the Russian revolution, she takes him in. A brief but passionate affair develops which influences both their work. With Anna Mouglalis and Mads Mikkelsen. In French, Russian and English.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy must face his past when an unexpected patient arrives at the hospital. Meanwhile, Fletch struggles with single parenthood as his work and home lives collide, and Ric makes a new enemy as he campaigns for the deputy CEO role.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At the Longleat Estate, Ben Fogle gets mobbed by a flock of rainbow-coloured lorikeets as they undergo a vital health check, while Kate Humble views a collection of giant stick insects using a special camera. Elsewhere, the park is on lock-down as they prepare to move over 30 lions, the biggest collection in Europe, into a new enclosure. Last in the series.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts examine properties up for auction, including a 100-year-old barn in Devon and three-bedroom homes in London and Lincolnshire. They follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress a few months later.

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist leads a team of rock climbers across Venezuela's tepuis - sheer-sided mountains surrounded by jungle. In the first episode, he attempts an ascent of a rockface that has never been climbed previously to discover what kind of animals live at the summit. However, to get there he will have to brave wildlife, rapids and a run-in with a rickety biplane.

programme.title: Now, Voyager
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville.

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Atletissima. Gabby Logan presents action from the 11th Diamond League event of the season, held at Stade Olympique de la Pontaise in Lausanne, Switzerland.

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Gabby Logan, in which four contestants answer questions for the right to roll balls along cash lanes. Round by round they try to usurp their competitors in the tactical stakes of runway selection, and the nearer their balls get to The Edge the more money they bank. However if they go over, they face elimination.

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Daphne reaches the end of her tether and decides it's time she came to an understanding with Sam - but is unsure whether he will co-operate. Comedy, starring Angela Thorne, Michael Elphick and Ray Burdis.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi
programme.desc: In a bid to liven up the camp, Joe Maplin decrees a weekly Sunshine Smile Day - giving perennial wide-boy Ted the perfect opportunity to fleece unsuspecting holiday-makers out of their spare cash. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker's latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington.

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the entertainer and presenter's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows, which have become classic viewing.

programme.title: Wild Wales
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the wildlife of Wales, including red deer, seals and red squirrels in Pembrokeshire. He also goes birdwatching in Glamorgan and Gwent, and visits waterfalls and caves in the Brecon Beacons.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The two remaining designers compete for a place in the quarter final, this time transforming two tiny bedrooms in medieval timber-framed houses in Sussex. The pair have very different briefs, with one designer facing the challenge of creating a Scandinavian-inspired scheme with a raised built-in bed. The other must deliver a Batman-inspired fantasy den, complete with bat motif lighting, a secret compartment, and dark grey walls. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit Castle Coole, near Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh. Items include a poignant reminder from the battlefields of the First World War, a modern painting of an Irish landscape and a collection of compacts.

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Patrick Kielty hosts a quiz show in which Carol Kirkwood, Rick Edwards and Sunetra Sarker use their knowledge and debating skills to try to help contestants win money.

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The culinary competition returns with chefs battling it out for the opportunity to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster celebrating ordinary Britons honoured by the Queen, with the contenders being challenged to showcase contemporary cuisine and demonstrate the transformation in British food during Elizabeth II's reign. The contest begins with entrants all representing Scotland for the first time, with Adam Handling, Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath preparing their starters.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the eighth of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from Robinson College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from Wadham College, Oxford, in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Verbivores take on the Channel Islanders in the general knowledge quiz. Both teams lost in their first appearance, but now have a second chance to remain in the tournament. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Minotaur, Frobscottle, Moloko Plus and Duff.

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Part two of two. With the help of Major Haroun Al-Qadir, Drake continues to investigate the mysterious murder of the young Indian-born lawyer, but things get tricky when it becomes clear that their enquiries are stepping on Special Branch's toes. Meanwhile, Jackson has to come up with another idea to save Long Susan from the hangman's noose, and Reid continues to dig into the conviction of his old friend Isaac Bloom, who is also soon set to face the gallows, Period drama, starring Matthew Macfadyen and MyAnna Buring.

programme.title: The Coopers vs The Rest
programme.desc: Tess wanted to save as many kids as she could from the sort of childhood she had, so she and her husband Toby adopted three children. Tess tries to improve Charlie's popularity by gatecrashing his classmate's 8th birthday party, while Toby has to deal with Alisha's sudden interest in religion. Comedy pilot, starring Paterson Joseph and Tanya Franks.

programme.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
programme.desc: A homeless youth in the ancient kingdom of Persia is adopted by the monarch and grows to become a great warrior. When the king is murdered, he is framed for the crime and forced to flee, and with the aid of a mysterious princess, he must stop a magical dagger with the power to control time from falling into evil hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton and Ben Kingsley.

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Darryl Grimason swims with sharks as he continues his underwater exploration of Northern Ireland's coastline.

programme.title: Coco Chanel & Igor Stravinsky
programme.desc: Fact-based drama examining the relationship between the fashion designer and the composer. Chanel is one of the few supporters of Stravinsky's controversial ballet The Rite of Spring, and when he is left penniless by the Russian revolution, she takes him in. A brief but passionate affair develops which influences both their work. With Anna Mouglalis and Mads Mikkelsen. In French, Russian and English.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy must face his past when an unexpected patient arrives at the hospital. Meanwhile, Fletch struggles with single parenthood as his work and home lives collide, and Ric makes a new enemy as he campaigns for the deputy CEO role.

programme.title: Ar Scath na Sleibhte
programme.desc: Cormac O hÁdhmaill returns to explore more of the mountains of Northern Ireland, meeting the people who live and work around them. He begins by walking along the coast and through the glens of Co Antrim in search of the story of the Feis na nGleann, and also visits Glenarm Castle. In Irish.

programme.title: Up There
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi.

programme.desc: Tess wanted to save as many kids as she could from the sort of childhood she had, so she and her husband Toby adopted three children. Tess tries to improve Charlie's popularity by gatecrashing his classmate's 8th birthday party, while Toby has to deal with Alisha's sudden interest in religion. Comedy pilot, starring Paterson Joseph and Tanya Franks.

programme.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
programme.desc: A homeless youth in the ancient kingdom of Persia is adopted by the monarch and grows to become a great warrior. When the king is murdered, he is framed for the crime and forced to flee, and with the aid of a mysterious princess, he must stop a magical dagger with the power to control time from falling into evil hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton and Ben Kingsley.

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Highlights from Snetterton, featuring the Renault UK Clio Cup and the Ginetta Junior Championship. Commentary by Richard John Neil.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Benidorm star Julie Graham talks about her role in new drama series One of Us and X Factor audition hopeful James Wilson chats about what it was like to perform in front of the judges. Ranvir Singh and Charlotte Hawkins present.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Fiona Phillips.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: Beethoven
programme.desc: An all-American family adopts a huge St Bernard, but the father is dismayed when it turns into a one-dog disaster zone. He insists the mutt must go to a new home, but when it is kidnapped by a crooked vet, dad has a change of heart and races to the rescue. Comedy, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Oliver Platt and David Duchovny.

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Playing to win thousands of pounds for charity this week are singer Ronan Keating, with his nine-year-old daughter Ali, actress Sheree Murphy, with her six-year-old daughter Matilda, and boxer Carl Froch, joined by his four-year-old son Rocco. Stephen Mulhern presents the entertainment show in which children spill the beans about their famous relatives.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Secret Dealers
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stevens, Simon Schneider and Mike Melody bid for a Sheffield silver inkwell by renowned makers Walker and Hall, plus a nine carat gold watch - however, things are not as they seem. Later, they visit a house full of vintage items, including rare 19th-century fire grenades.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Off Their Rockers
programme.desc: Seb learns the provocative dance move of twerking and gets tied to a lamp post, Rosie strips to reveal rather unusual undergarments and Sonia's sat-nav has a mind of its own. Hidden-camera comedy in which fearless senior citizens perform stunts and pranks on the streets of Britain.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zak insists he should join Lisa when she goes to identify Belle's body and Rhona is worried that Paddy has yet to reply to her letter telling him about her and Pierce. Holly begs Megan for another chance and Bernice stirs things up to get Andy's name cleared, while Robert insists they take it slowly.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria finally snaps and tells Eva her relationship with Aidan won't last before she crosses paths with a burglar. Meanwhile, Sally tells Phelan she may have to withdraw her support because his proposed development will mean the knocking down of the community hall.

programme.title: Celebrity Home Secrets
programme.desc: New series. Famous faces revisit their former homes to share their memories and secrets from when they lived there, beginning with actor Nigel Havers. He goes to the London flat where he lived when he got his first professional job aged 15, and where Mick Jagger and Keith Richards attended a celebratory party in 1967 after Nigel's father Michael Havers QC represented them at the Court of Appeal. He also goes to the basement flat in Fulham where he was living when he got his first big break in BBC mini-series A Horseman Riding By.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Caz comes to Maria's aid after she is attacked by a burglar, while Phelan uses Alex as a pawn in his plan to build on the community hall site. Elsewhere, Nick celebrates being back with Leanne, and Jenny tells Johnny how the factory staff have been taking him for a ride.

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: As Lord Melbourne's popularity in the house wanes, the Tories eagerly await their imminent triumph, while the Duke of Cumberland views it as a chance to prey on his niece's vulnerability and establish a co-regency with the Duchess of Kent and Conroy. Victoria is devastated when Melbourne regretfully announces he is stepping down and even more bewildered that she must ask complete stranger Sir Robert Peel to form a government, and she desperately implores Melbourne to return. Period drama, starring Jenna Colman and Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Madge comes to terms with bad news from her doctor and makes the most of her last few days in the sun, while Mick braces himself to tell the family about her diagnosis. Kenneth decides to go on a health kick, hiring Liam as his personal trainer, and the Solana guests take part in an eating competition, organised by Cyril in his new role as assistant manager. He's keen to ensure they use the cheapest food available, and the resulting hog roast leads to the contestants taking on more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Britain As Seen on ITV
programme.desc: A selection of clips showing how the representation of women on TV has changed over the past 60 years, including a report on the fashion craze of hot pants that asks whether men should be wearing them as well. Plus, a 1970s beauty contest where the contestants had the strangest of ambitions and a 1980s series from Scotland that encouraged women to take up DIY. Jane Horrocks narrates.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The heads of an Ivy-League private college tempt fate by inviting Jessica to lecture to their pupils, and it is not long before the sleuth has a murder to investigate. Angela Lansbury stars.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.
