He's keen to ensure they use the cheapest food available, and the resulting hog roast leads to the contestants taking on more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the 13th round of the season at the Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: The boys arrive home to find a `For Sale' sign in front of the house, and are intent on preventing their parents from selling the family home. Jim is attracted to the proposition however, and comes round as a potential buyer. Comedy, starring Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig and Paul Ritter. Last in the series.

programme.title: Walking the Himalayas
programme.desc: Levison Wood and guide Binod Pariyar face a 30-mile trek through the jungles of Eastern Nepal, with no roads and few people to tell them they are heading in the right direction. Their journey comes to an end in Bhutan, a country rarely visited by foreigners, where they visit a holy mountain, join the celebrations for the king's birthday, and listen to local children's tales of yeti.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two couples who wanted to buy property in Torbay, Devon. Newlyweds Sam and Jamie needed Kirstie's help to put a difficult few years behind them, while Geoff and Sharon were making the move to nearby Torquay and hoped to find a home big enough for them, their children and Sharon's mother.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time model and writer Azzi Kalili hosts the first dinner party in west London. She erects a Moroccan marquee in her garden, but seems oblivious to her freezing guests and their dislike of her food.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Plumber Steve Capel hosts the second party in west London, putting together his favourite dish, a roulade of ostrich, kudu and springbok. However, his plans to entertain the other diners with a demonstration of his nunchuk skills are cut abruptly short when an injury sustained in the kitchen comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ex-wedding planner and self-confessed perfectionist Zae Greenwood hosts the third dinner party in west London. He tries to impress his guests with a wedding-style menu, but they do not respond well to his culinary efforts.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events organiser Emma Boardman Magliocchetti hosts the penultimate dinner party in west London. She hopes to prove to her new Italian husband that she can be the perfect wife and create an incredible feast, despite never having cooked a three-course meal before.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jane Welch hosts the final dinner party in west London, and has asked her guests to appear in fancy dress. The busy mother is initially nervous about the evening and her adventurous menu, but becomes emotional when her diners compliment the meal. Plus, the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.

programme.title: That Darn Cat
programme.desc: A maid is accidentally kidnapped, but manages to attach a message asking for help to a cat. The animal's teenage owner goes to an FBI agent and they try to persuade the mischievous moggy to lead them to the hostage - but it is more interested in causing trouble along the way. Disney comedy remake, starring Christina Ricci, Doug E Doug and Dean Jones, who also starred in the original.

programme.title: Moshi Monsters: The Movie
programme.desc: Premiere. The strange creatures discover a magical egg, but evil inventor Dr Strangeglove is determined to put it to his own nefarious purposes, and sends his minions to steal it. A small band of monsters join forces to prevent the egg from falling into the wrong hands. Animated adventure, with the voices of Emma Tate and Ashley Slater.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Girl Who Slept Too Little.
programme.desc: A construction project causes the local graveyard to be moved next to the family's home - to the dismay of Lisa, who is so concerned by the development she begins to suffer nightmares. She eventually decides the best way to conquer her fear is by facing it head on and spending a night at the cemetery.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse is dismayed to learn his estranged parents are considering a reconciliation and schemes to break them up again, helped by Bart and an idea borrowed from an episode of TV series The OC. Unfortunately, their devious scheme only succeeds in convincing Homer that Marge is having an affair.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is so upset at Homer's failure to appreciate her lovingly crafted home-made Father's Day gift that she ends up going on a rampage through the school. Meanwhile, Bart is bullied into stealing a road sign.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Mamas.
programme.desc: Marge joins a women's group, but soon discovers her fellow members plan to steal $1million from Mr Burns. Meanwhile, Lisa decides to spend the summer in Rome and hires a tutor to teach her Italian. Unfortunately, he turns out to be Milhouse.

programme.title: Escape from Planet Earth
programme.desc: Premiere. A heroic alien space explorer travels to Earth in response to a distress call. When he ends up being captured by the military and imprisoned in the infamous Area 51, it falls to his timid, nerdy brother to save him. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Rob Corddry, Brendan Fraser and Sarah Jessica Parker.

programme.title: Honey, I Blew Up the Kid
programme.desc: A scientist perfects a device for making objects grow when they come into contact with electricity. Unfortunately, his two-year-old son is accidentally turned into a giant and goes on the rampage through the streets of Las Vegas. Disney comedy sequel, starring Rick Moranis, Marcia Strassman, Robert Oliveri and Lloyd Bridges.

programme.title: Wedding Town
programme.desc: Derek and Nicole are looking forward to their garden-themed ceremony, while hotel manager Gillian desperately tries to think of new ideas to drum up business.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Gloria Hunniford joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: Gok's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: New parents Sara and Ryan have worked hard to get their Edwardian semi renovated and need a bit of help to get it finally finished, including an overhaul of their bedroom.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first host in Cambridgeshire is science teacher Sam, who is confident his Canadian charm will pave his way to victory, while brand manager Lisa hopes to sway her guests with a night of glamour held at her mansion. Community radio producer Merlin and theatre director Julia are the other contestants in a week of dinner parties featuring uncomfortable Jacuzzi dining, unlikely celebrity lookalikes and unusual games of hide and seek.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield.
programme.desc: Ratings for Krusty's TV show start to fall, so executives bring in co-star Princess Penelope (voiced by Anne Hathaway) to increase its appeal, and romance soon blossoms between the clown and his new sidekick. Elsewhere, Mr Burns cuts costs at the nuclear plant by taking away the staff's free doughnuts.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Joe refuses to speak to Mercedes, while Diego tries to help free her from prison - but he cannot get in touch with Maria. Elsewhere, Peri suspects that Nico is connected to Tom's ill health, and Courtney and Cameron clash, with Leela caught in the middle.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: Joe Wicks: The Body Coach
programme.desc: The online nutrition coach gives a group of people fitness advice and tips for healthy eating, demonstrating superfast, tasty recipes and short, intense work-outs. Among those hoping to be transformed are a fireman who has struggled with fighting the flab, a police officer who worries her colleagues use the word bubbly as code for fat and a couple who want to lose weight for their honeymoon.

programme.title: Make My Body Better with Davina McCall
programme.desc: This edition focuses on 32st teaching assistant James, who finds a simple walk along the street a feat of endurance and the 27-year-old's health and life are at risk. After a drastic medical intervention, Davina challenges to lose 15st, train to be a jockey and ride against professionals at a major horse-racing event.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Receptionist Kirsty has high expectations for her date with Oliver and wastes no time in telling him that she wants marriage and kids very soon. DJ Tom struggles with confidence away from his decks and is matched with classics student Olivia, who has never had a date before.

programme.title: My Millionaire Dads and Me
programme.desc: Documentary following millionaires Tony and Barrie Drewitt-Barlow and their family, who came to fame in 1999 as the first British gay fathers to pay for surrogate mothers. Sixteen years later, their eldest children are about to celebrate a milestone birthday, and their parents are planning an extravagant party to celebrate, including expensive coming of age presents. The programme follows the family across a year of social events, gifts and GCSEs as they struggle to combine life as a `normal' family with the demands of the media.

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: People who risk ruining their own lives for the sake of a night out, including a professional footballer almost triple the legal drink drive limit while on his way to training after drinking heavily the night before. In Crewe, PCs Vicky Howell and Greg Greaves get an eyeful on their Saturday night patrol as they stop a man walking along a main road, naked from the waist down. He doesn't know where his trousers are and it's down to the police to make sure he gets home safely.

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle: Walking Dead Special.
programme.desc: LL Cool J and Chrissy Teigen preside over another celebrity musical battle as actresses Lauren Cohan and Sonequa Martin-Green compete. Both star together in the horror series The Walking Dead, but here they face off to determine who can most adequately fake performing two hit tracks of their choice, in front of a live studio audience.

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: Suspects
programme.desc: As the investigation into Lucy's abduction continues, Jack finds it impossible to sit on the sidelines as just a witness and next of kin. However, his attempt to help threatens to disrupt inquiries, forcing Drummond to reprimand him. Meanwhile, Gary discovers Lucy visited a club owned by two notorious criminals, and a young man enters the station with significant information.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice meets homeowners near Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, who are having trouble selling up. She shows them how to inject a touch of vitality and character into their bland property.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Californian interior designer and estate agent Ann Maurice visits a cluttered B&B in the town of Wells-next-the-Sea on the Norfolk coast that is in need of attention.

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: Otto shows off by climbing a tree.

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Big Chris has problems while flying a helicopter.

programme.title: The WotWots
programme.desc: SpottyWot's brightest shiny crayons go missing, so his sister sets out to find them.

programme.title: Chloe's Closet
programme.desc: Chloe, Jet and Danny spend the day playing volleyball, and have a new friend who is a secret weapon.

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: A disc by Salty's old band, The Fiddlin' Flatfish, is washed up on the beach. Lily finds out that he misses them, so she put together a new line-up.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Everyone is excited about the Pontypandy Flower and Vegetable Show being held in the Floods' garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George's favourite toy Mr Dinosaur breaks, so he goes to Mr Fox's shop to get a replacement and spots Dino Roar - which has a host of new features.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Muck is tasked with calming down Bella the elephant - after he frightened her in the first place. Animated antics with the friendly handyman.

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The castle suffers a power cut just as the household is preparing for a birthday party.

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.sub-title: Pip and Alba's Big Day Out.
programme.desc: Alba and Pip arrange an expedition to find a butterfly with Hopper and Pasty, but encounter trouble when the insect flies to the top of a tree.

programme.title: The Milkshake! Show
programme.desc: Amy and Olivia have fun building some colourful bird houses.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Flynn the Fire Engine takes to the road after having his wheels fixed by Victor.

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of Bling's Hidden Present.
programme.desc: Bling is so excited about her birthday that she starts opening all her presents ahead of schedule. Big Ear's hides his gift to stop her, but ends up forgetting where he put it.

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The elves and fairies encounter a speaking door and a dwarf mine while on the lookout for Gaston.

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Peggy feels left out because all the baby penguins except her have had their own special day, so Wissper organises a party.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George feels left out of Peppa and Suzy Sheep's game.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The young pig and George look up to the stars on a stargazing trip with Mummy and Daddy Pig.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The Patrol have to save Little Hooty's mum when the tree she is in blows over during a storm and is close to falling in the water.

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: When Blue Claw the crab mistakes another seagull for Gus, it's up to the real Gus to rescue Blue Claw before he ends up in trouble.

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: Rat and the Teddies collect toys for children, but the Bananas find it hard to choose which of their playthings to give away.

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.

programme.title: Cowboy Builders
programme.desc: The team returns to Grays in Essex to catch up with David and Victoria Gray, who bought a property with plans to renovate and remortgage it so they could pay off loans and cover the cost of IVF treatment. However, the builder they employed left their home in a shambles and their dreams in tatters. Viewers see whether the Grays have pushed forward with their project or whether it has ground to a halt.

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Mason makes a risky decision, Marilyn is bemused by John's reluctance to discipline Jordan, while VJ and Billie's relationship reaches breaking point.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Gary sacrifices his freedom to protect his daughter, Terese contemplates whether she can help Xanthe, Piper believes Elly is out to get her, while Paige basks in Jack's attention.

programme.title: Monte Walsh
programme.desc: An ageing cowboy tries to find a place for himself in the world as the Wild West becomes increasingly civilised. He hopes to marry a former saloon girl whose health is failing, but finds there is little work to do for someone with his talents - until his friend is killed by a thief and he has grounds for revenge. Western, starring Lee Marvin, Jack Palance and Jeanne Moreau. Edited for language.

programme.title: Joe Kidd
programme.desc: A bounty hunter is asked to capture a Mexican rebel, and accepts the job after the outlaw's men attack his own ranch. But when he witnesses the cruel methods used by his employer, he resolves to bring the fugitive to a fair trial rather than let him face rough justice. Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Robert Duvall and John Saxon. Edited for language and violence.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Gary sacrifices his freedom to protect his daughter, Terese contemplates whether she can help Xanthe, Piper believes Elly is out to get her, while Paige basks in Jack's attention.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Mason makes a risky decision, Marilyn is bemused by John's reluctance to discipline Jordan, while VJ and Billie's relationship reaches breaking point.

programme.title: D-Day's Sunken Secrets
programme.desc: Using two mini-submarines, a group of historians, wreck detectives, scientists and D-Day veterans go on an expedition to search the seabed for items from the Normandy landings of June 1944. Among the objects the team finds are a collection of American Sherman tanks that were specially adapted to float, and the wreck of the SS Leopoldville, a troopship sunk by a U-boat in December 1944 with the loss of more than 800 lives. Richard Armitage narrates.

programme.title: Adolf and Eva: Love and War
programme.desc: Drama-documentary about Eva Braun, from her teenage infatuation with Adolf Hitler to their wedding and joint suicide in a Berlin bunker, exposes the power she wielded over the increasingly delusional fascist dictator. The film combines her home movies, with archive clips, dramatic reconstructions and interviews with the leading experts on the Nazi inner circle to reveal why she fell for a man like Hitler and just how much she knew about the murderous activities of the Nazi Party.

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: During the Second World War, German businessman Oskar Schindler strives to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Ka Pilo'ohana Ka 'Oi (Family Comes First).
programme.desc: SWAT captain Lou Grover finds himself facing a dilemma when a fugitive computer hacker (guest star Nick Jonas of Jonas Brothers fame) kidnaps the lawman's daughter to force him to help steal $100million. How many lines will Grover cross to secure the release of his child? Meanwhile, master criminal Wo Fat lands squarely back on the team's radar. Crime drama, with Chi McBride, Scott Caan and Alex O'Loughlin. Last in the series.

programme.title: Air Ambulance ER
programme.desc: Documentary following Britain's emergency helicopter medical services. A team races to the aid of a mother and daughter involved in a high-speed motorcycle crash, before zipping off to the Lake District to help a cyclist hit by a car. Timing is everything, too, when the crew turn their attention to a four-year-old girl with a serious leg fracture.

programme.title: Mount Pleasant
programme.desc: The truth behind landlord Trevor's scheming is revealed, throwing the residents of Mount Pleasant into grave danger when a fire breaks out at the pub. Broken hearts, jealousies and marital woes are all put aside as lovers, friends and bitter rivals all pull together to save the lives of those trapped inside. Last in the series.

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line
programme.desc: Officers suspect an IT consultant has arrived for more than just a holiday, and a surfer returns from Southeast Asia with a dodgy souvenir.

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line
programme.desc: The Inland Enforcement Team tracks down an alleged sex offender, while a detector dog sniffs out trouble in an unclaimed suitcase from Dubai.

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line
programme.desc: A Canadian wanted in Alberta is stopped en route to Ecuador, and a parcel of baby food contains surprising ingredients.

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line
programme.desc: A Russian dissident's complicated past raises questions, and officers wonder why a Korean tourist would bring his CV and school diplomas on holiday.

programme.title: The Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar Millan helps a former ATF sniffer dog that appears to be suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Staff members worry about the health of a newborn monkey, while infant orang-utan Dinda gets to grips with the outside enclosure, and stump-tailed macaque Koko has difficulties with her living accommodation.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The life of a baby woolly monkey hangs in the balance just 24 hours after its birth and Charlie is bullied by other chimps, meaning his days of living in the bachelor group could be numbered.

programme.title: Ashley Banjo's Secret Street Crew
programme.desc: Beauticians from Loughton, Essex, enlist the help of the Diversity frontman to teach them how to street dance, but problems arise when one member of the group becomes age-conscious, and another's negative attitude holds her back.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry tries to prevent Earth from being turned into a giant litter tray when it is invaded by a race of intelligent cats, and Nibbler confronts Leela after growing tired of her treating him as a pet.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The theory of evolution is put to the test on a planet populated by robots. Sci-fi capers from The Simpsons creator Matt Groening.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: The programme in which a groom takes sole charge of organising his wedding transfers to Sky, with the first episode seeing Adam being given just three weeks, £14,000 and the help of his best men to give his fiancee Bianca the wedding of her dreams. The pregnant bride-to-be would like a simple, classic day to remember, but Adam has other plans.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Maria has placed her faith in teenage sweetheart Ryan to deliver her dream of a traditional church wedding, but he wants the ceremony to take place at the college where they first met. The prospective groom has just three weeks to organise the event and his bride-to-be can only hope they are on the same page and that she gets the wedding of her dreams.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Holly is hoping for a warm, cosy family wedding, but her cowboy-loving fiance Cole has a Wild West theme in mind and has three weeks to plan the occasion.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Kloe dreams of a romantic ceremony on a Mediterranean beach, but her fiance Lawrence has his sights set on a funfair-themed day and she has agreed to hand over total control of the wedding to her other half.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart has the bright idea of taking out a credit card in Santa's Little Helper's name and orders a fully trained pedigree collie. Unfortunately, he has trouble keeping up the payments and soon receives a visit from bailiffs wanting to repossess all his purchases.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Old Man and the Lisa.
programme.desc: Lisa takes pity on a bankrupt Mr Burns and encourages him to build a recycling centre, hoping it will get him back on his feet - but makes the mistake of underestimating his ruthlessness. Featuring the guest voice of wrestler Bret Hart.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge begins work as a church volunteer and restores Reverend Lovejoy's faith in his vocation, while Homer is baffled to discover his image printed on a box of Japanese washing powder.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns hires a hard-working, conscientious new employee, who takes an instant dislike to the slobbish Homer and sets about trying to humiliate him. Meanwhile, Bart buys an abandoned factory for a dollar at a government auction and gives Milhouse the job of nightwatchman.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Troy McClure hosts three spin-off segments, transplanting characters from the show into new situations and locations, including Chief Wiggum's attempt to make his name as a private investigator, ably assisted by streetwise sidekick Principal Skinner, alias `Skinny Boy'.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson.
programme.desc: Homer and Marge force Bart to enrol in a military academy and Lisa unwisely follows him. Once in her own barracks she is snubbed by the other cadets - but receives unexpected help from Bart to tackle the assault course. Featuring the guest voice of Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is fired from the power plant and becomes so dejected that he contemplates suicide - until a near-tragic road accident makes him realise his purpose in life is to make Springfield safer.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: A revolutionary invention allows Fry, Leela, Bender and their friends to switch minds - causing chaos in the process.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The team consoles alien leader Lrrr when he goes through a midlife crisis after an unsuccessful attempt to invade Earth.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A mysterious cat burglar ransacks the Simpson household, making off with Lisa's saxophone. Homer becomes the leader of a neighbourhood watch scheme to find the miscreant - but soon lets the power go to his head. Featuring the guest voice of Sam Neill.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart lands a job as assistant to his idol Krusty the Clown and even gets to say his own catchphrase in front of the cameras, winning instant celebrity status. Featuring the guest voice of TV host Conan O'Brien.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself being rushed to hospital suffering from food poisoning as a consequence of Apu's misconduct at the Kwik-E-Mart. Featuring the guest voice of James Woods.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: The sports-based comedy quiz returns for a 10th season, hosted as usual by James Corden, with team captains Jamie Redknapp and Andrew Flintoff and regular panellist Jack Whitehall. They are joined on the first edition by West Ham United striker Andy Carroll, comedy actor and writer David Walliams and former Spice Girl Melanie C.

programme.title: Football's Funniest Moments
programme.desc: A look back at laugh-out-loud incidents from the world of Premier League football, including interviews with players, pundits and comedians.

programme.title: Rugby's Funniest Moments
programme.desc: A chance to revisit a selection of the sport's most amusing moments.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: James Corden presents the quiz, joined by team captains Jamie Redknapp and Freddie Flintoff and regular panellist Jack Whitehall, welcome New York City FC's Frank Lampard, comedian Kevin Bridges and Judy Murray, mother of tennis star Andy.

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Captain Gregson reveals details about his private life when his home is invaded by a masked gunman. Although his wife Cheryl is shaken by the ordeal, Sherlock does not assume she is innocent. Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu star.

programme.title: Madam Secretary
programme.desc: A plane carrying the Moldovan prime minister and one of Elizabeth's former CIA colleagues vanishes, while Henry's NSA work places him in grave danger.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth tries to find out whether a young lupus patient's use of medical marijuana and a job at a drug dispensary could be linked to her murder, and away from the case, he's determined to excel in the FBI competency test, but Brennan worries he has prioritised the physical aspect of the exam over the intellectual side of it. Meanwhile, Wendell updates the team on his cancer treatment, but makes an indiscretion that could get him fired.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan re-evaluates her relationship with Booth when Afghanistan war correspondent Hannah Burley pays him a surprise visit, and the duo try to piece together the identities of two people from remains found in a cave. Guest starring Katheryn Winnick (Failure to Launch).

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Alex has to choose which of two newborn twins gets a liver transplant. April and Jackson's marriage hits a new low and Maggie receives an invitation to her ex's wedding.

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: An elderly patient encourages Arizona not to give up on romance, Maggie and Andrew deal with the aftermath of their hook-up and Owen gives the interns a lesson in breaking bad news.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The police are suspicious of a man who is wearing two pairs of trousers and two jackets, and they listen in amusement to his feeble attempts at a credible explanation. Plus, two car thieves wearing washing-up gloves make a swift getaway, but are halted when they collide with a cameraman.

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: Documentary exposing outrageous stories of excess and expense in the world of the super-rich, with the first episode exploring three status-defining toys every billionaire must have - a private jet, a collection of supercars and a mega-yacht.

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: A peek inside the mansions of the super-rich, complete with concierge services, ice rooms and sushi bars.

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: A look at the wide range of people employed by today's billionaires to provide for their every whim, from butlers and nutritionists to florists and art consultants.

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: A look at the spending habits of the richest people in the world, taking in extravagant purchases including gold-plated cots, trips to the Arctic and a million-dollar vacuum cleaner.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Gideon faces his biggest challenge yet when he tries to persuade a cornered sadistic murderer to reveal the location of a woman he has abducted. Starring Mandy Patinkin and Thomas Gibson.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The investigation into a series of deaths near construction sites and abandoned homes leads the team to suspect a homeless man of the crimes. Meanwhile, Reid's apparent behavioural changes become a cause for concern. Starring Matthew Gray Gubler.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Several family homes are set on fire by an environmental activist, leading the BAU to discover a connection between the targeted properties and a number of corporate companies accused of building on contaminated land. Drama following the work of FBI agents, starring Mandy Patinkin.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A serial killer reappears after 20 years of inactivity and contacts the Behavioural Analysis Unit through Gideon's retired mentor - and the chase to find him heats up when he threatens to strike again within the next five days. Drama, starring Mandy Patinkin.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The mutilated bodies of five students are found in an unoccupied house in New Mexico. The Behavioural Analysis Unit suspects the involvement of a cult with knowledge of Native American rituals - a hypothesis seemingly confirmed by the discovery that the murder scene stands on the site of an old Apache burial ground. Drama, starring Matthew Gray Gubler.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team travels to New York City to investigate a series of murders apparently committed by a vigilante exacting revenge on acquitted former convicts. Drama, starring Thomas Gibson, AJ Cook, Matthew Gray Gubler and Mandy Patinkin.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Reid helps to conduct a training seminar for the LAPD in California, where he becomes attracted to a TV starlet who is being stalked by a killer linked to several recent showbiz murders, including the death of a producer. Drama, starring Matthew Gray Gubler, Mandy Patinkin and Thomas Gibson.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: An Italian tourist is questioned about his travel documents by officials, an American couple argue with quarantine officers in Melbourne and a passenger's anxious behaviour arouses suspicion.

programme.title: Cooks to Market
programme.desc: The culinary competition continues as two teams attempt to transform the takeaway market. Given just £250 and a few hours, the rivals make original soup and cheesecake products on a commercial scale and sell them at one of London's busiest shopping centres. The duo who make the greater profit then pitch their creation to a board of investors in a bid to become a household brand. Presented by Gizzi Erskine and James Averdieck.

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules: Australia
programme.desc: In the sixth People's Choice challenge, the remaining teams must prepare a meal to be featured in Coles Magazine.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU officers pursue a serial killer whose trademark is covering victims in scratches. Investigations reveal the murders are probably being committed by someone suffering from an obsessive skin disorder, but little more can be gleaned. As further victims bearing the same claw marks are found, the team has to determine a way of quickly bringing down the perpetrator. Alicia Coppola guest stars, with David Rossi and Derek Morgan.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents try to get inside the mind of a kidnapper in Phoenix who is depriving his victims of sleep, while Hotch and Garcia investigate a threat made by an underground group calling themselves the Dirty Dozen. Crime drama, starring Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: Shades of Blue
programme.desc: With Saperstein's life hanging in the balance, Harlee struggles to protect him from Wozniak, who is torn between his conscience and a need to finish the job. Jennifer Lopez stars.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Jason Gideon embarks on his first investigation with the FBI's Behavioral Analysis Unit since suffering a breakdown, as he and the team look into the disappearance of four Seattle women in as many months. The agents find a likely suspect, but realise he has an accomplice. First episode of the crime drama, starring Mandy Patinkin.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.sub-title: The Knight in White Satin Armour.
programme.desc: Pussy's loyalty to the Mob wavers and Tony's mistress puts pressure on him to continue their affair, while a domestic quarrel between Janice and Richie has a decidedly deadly outcome. James Gandolfini stars.

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: President Meyer and her staff are on the back foot when a junior member of the team hacks medical and social security records to support the Families First bill.

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Selina welcomes a US journalist out of captivity in Iran, and adds a sycophantic new member to the team, while Dan lines up a potential new job opportunity.

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: The president moves to replace vice president Andrew Doyle when Senator O'Brien acquires an eye-catching new running mate, and Karen finally pushes Amy too far.

programme.title: The Petrol Age
programme.desc: Paul McGann explores how British luxury car manufacturers became internationally renowned as leaders in their field. He profiles engineers and designers including Charles Rolls and Henry Royce, discovers why 1950s socialite Lady Docker developed a fascination with Daimlers, and drives a selection of the models that helped establish Bentley as one of the world's most sought-after marques.

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates how Moscow has changed since the break-up of the USSR and meets some of the city's most influential residents, including fashion designer Masha Tsigal and billionaire retail magnate Mikhail Kusnirovich. He also discovers the lingering influence of the KGB and talks to former secret service agent Anatoly Ermolin.

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard, the owners of Carlton Towers near Selby in North Yorkshire, prepare to host a fitness boot camp weekend at their property - while also welcoming an array of guests to celebrate their son's birthday. Meanwhile, Sir Benjamin Slade hopes a murder mystery weekend at Maunsel House in Somerset will help pay off a sizeable electricity bill.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team investigates after the body of a former star jockey reported missing in 1986 is found in a mass grave for horses. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris, Danny Pino and John Finn.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The files are reopened on the unsolved 1991 case of a 14-year-old girl who was murdered months after she was placed with new foster parents and had started establishing herself as a gifted rapper within the local hip-hop community.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet attempts to veto a controversial new `death tax' bill supported by the House of Representatives, putting his hard-pressed staff well and truly on the spot. Josh tries to influence Governor Buckland, CJ rebukes Sherri and Charlie is advised to ask for immunity in his forthcoming testimony. Anna Deavere Smith guest stars.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A mobster who fell into a coma moments before testifying in court is brought in for treatment, but his brother begs House to keep him in hospital to stop him taking the stand. The grumpy medic soon has cause for concern when it transpires the gangster has been poisoned.

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack, Samantha and Danny try to track down a gunman who has shot Martin during an ambush and left him in a critical condition - but interference by senior FBI officials complicates the task. With Anthony LaPaglia and Eric Close.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The crime family Jamie infiltrated orders the assassination of Jimmy Riordan, his undercover alias - so Frank puts him under house arrest for protection. Meanwhile, Danny and Jackie investigate the suspicious death of a big-spending investor who sustained serious injuries in a fight.

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Teenager Logan starts work as an apprentice deck-hand, while landlady Pat recalls fond memories from her life in Brixham.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens Stillman's 1983 case of a Chinese-American teenager who was murdered three months after his girlfriend was killed by gang members. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris and Danny Pino.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the 1999 case of a high-school debate champion whose death was originally ruled as suicide, and suspicion surrounds the victim's then new team-mates, with jealousy the suspected motive.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Vice President is asked to speak at an anti-gun rally in Texas, while Donna appears before a Congressional committee investigating President Bartlet's failure to disclose his medical condition - and lies under oath.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An obese 10-year-old is brought in after suffering a heart attack, apparently caused by diet pills. When bleeding sores appear on the youngster's chest, the doctors look to each other for someone to blame. Meanwhile, House is ordered to sack one of the team.

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a teenager who is believed to have gone missing so he can execute an elaborate plan to bomb his school. They learn that bullies had picked a fight with him the day before his disappearance, and discover he had a chilling obsession with safety.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The Reagans prepare to mark Mother's Day, an occasion that holds particular significance for them - but Frank struggles to focus on his family's needs as he tries to prevent a biological weapons attack on New York City. Meanwhile, a long-standing conflict between Danny and Jamie finally boils over.

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: The head of the Russian mob hits LA to find out what happened to Belikov. Meanwhile, Sonia takes refuge at the Donovan house. Starring Liev Schreiber and Jon Voight.

programme.title: Vice Principals
programme.desc: Russell sets up a confrontation between Dr Brown and a formidable opponent, while Gamby seeks to impress his daughter. Comedy, starring Danny McBride and Walton Goggins.

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Spencer receives bad news from the doctor, Reggie looks to cheer Vernon up with an unusual pet, and Ricky bumps into an old flame.

programme.title: The Crash Reel
programme.desc: Lucy Walker's documentary charts American snowboarder Kevin Pearce's rehabilitation after suffering a traumatic brain injury during training for the 2010 Winter Olympics. The film examines the potentially high price of participation in extreme sports and sheds light on the trend of athletes pushing the boundaries in their pursuit of glory.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Bedfordshire police pursue a car thief driving recklessly around the streets of Luton, who then tries to evade capture by running away and climbing through the window of a building. Officers are also called to an accident on a country lane, where a teenage driver needs freeing from the wreckage - but that is not the end of his problems. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.

programme.title: Being Human USA
programme.sub-title: It's My Party and I'll Die If I Want To.
programme.desc: Aiden plots to save Suren by killing Mother. Sally tries to bring Nick back from limbo, and Nora tells Josh that she has found a way to cure them both.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? USA
programme.desc: US actor and comedian Jason Sudeikis travels across America to learn the story of his father's ancestors.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Doctors Revisited
programme.desc: A look back at the 10th Doctor, played by David Tennant from 2005 to 2010. He took the series to new heights of global popularity while battling foes including the Weeping Angels and the Wire.

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Dynamo: Magician Impossible
programme.desc: A countdown of the magician's most impressive illusions, voted for by viewers of the show and featuring contributions from celebrity fans, including DJ Scott Mills, actor Mathew Horne, comedian Leigh Francis (Keith Lemon) and rap star Tinie Tempah.

programme.title: MasterChef Australia: The Professionals
programme.desc: The three finalists face a trio of daunting challenges to decide the overall winner, including a leek and lobster terrine.

programme.title: Fly Away Home
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl finds an abandoned nest of goose eggs and raises the chicks when they hatch. As winter approaches, the birds need to fly south, so she and her inventor father construct a light aircraft to lead the way. Family adventure, starring Jeff Daniels, Anna Paquin, Dana Delany and Terry Kinney.

programme.title: Patch Adams
programme.desc: A talented student doctor turns the medical community upside down with his offbeat views about the healing power of laughter. His methods provoke outrage and intense debate among his professors - but his extrovert nature brightens the lives of all kinds of patients. Comedy drama, starring Robin Williams, Monica Potter, Daniel London, Bob Gunton and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Far and Away
programme.desc: Penniless Irish farmer Joseph seeks revenge on the cruel landowner who drove him from his home. However, the landlord's daughter, desperate to escape her family, persuades him to join her in seeking their fortune in America. The pair plan to stake a claim in the Oklahoma gold rush, but instead Joseph is forced to become a bare-knuckle fighter to support them. Romantic drama set in the 1890s, starring Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman.

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan
programme.desc: A chambermaid at an exclusive hotel daringly tries on a designer dress belonging to a guest - and is spotted by a wealthy politician, who mistakes her for a socialite and invites her on a date. However, the differences in their social backgrounds soon become apparent and threaten their budding romance. Comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ralph Fiennes, Natasha Richardson and Bob Hoskins.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Sue and Pete try to make it peacefully through a wedding day, while the children interrogate the bride, test the vicar's faith in God and dip unsuitable things in the chocolate fountain. Comedy, starring Hugh Dennis and Claire Skinner.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Ben tries to get elected as the class rep, while Pete returns from a colleague's funeral troubled by mortality, money problems and the anaconda attack his son is filming in the garden. Domestic comedy, starring Hugh Dennis and Claire Skinner.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Sue and Pete ban TV and computers for one whole Sunday, freeing up quality time for family pastimes such as hide-and-seek and card games. Meanwhile, Ben's head master seems strangely keen for him to take a few days off school, and Grandad comes to stay. Partly improvised comedy, starring Hugh Dennis and Claire Skinner.

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: New series. Culinary challenge based on the original British version, following aspiring chefs through successive elimination rounds as they try to prove their skills by preparing a variety of dishes. British-born chef Gary Mehigan, chef George Calombaris and food critic Matt Preston are the judges casting their eyes over the contestants as they prepare a signature dish for a chance to reach the top 24.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride USA
programme.desc: American version of the documentary in which a groom is given $25,000 to plan every detail of his nuptials, while the bride relinquishes control of the big day. Property dealer Bryan has three weeks to make all the arrangements for his wedding to Latresea, with only his brother Austin as best man to help.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise grows suspicious of Ben's behaviour, Bex seeks advice from Stacey, and Steven is frustrated when Lauren buys a laptop to help her pitch for new business, despite the financial difficulties at Beale's continuing to grow.

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on stories dominating the media in April 2013, on TV, online and in print, as well as picking up on overlooked items that raise a smile. Plus, a mystery guest who has featured in the news, joins him on stage.

programme.title: Life Is Toff
programme.desc: Reality series following the aristocratic Fulford family at their 800-year-old country estate, as the youngest generation of the family comes of age. The opening episode sees youngest brother Edmund falling foul of a hole in the wall, while the family are divided over eldest son Arthur's plans for the estate he will one day inherit.

programme.title: 15 Storeys High
programme.desc: Vince falls for aqua-aerobics instructor Stacey, and finds himself volunteering to take part in a charity swimathon - despite being unable to swim. Meanwhile, Errol allows a single mum to practice her `salsasice' in their living room.

programme.title: 15 Storeys High
programme.desc: Vince has an eventful day, running the gauntlet of gangs of youths in the lifts and shopping his elderly neighbour to the local authorities, for feeding pigeons which use his windows as a public toilet. However, when she is evicted, he is overwhelmed with guilt, and he resolves to track her down. Sean Lock stars.

programme.title: jam
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy featuring bizarre and surreal sketches. Amelia Bullmore, David Cann, Julia Davis, Kevin Eldon and Mark Heap star.

programme.title: 15 Storeys High
programme.desc: Vince falls for aqua-aerobics instructor Stacey, and finds himself volunteering to take part in a charity swimathon - despite being unable to swim. Meanwhile, Errol allows a single mum to practice her `salsasice' in their living room.

programme.title: 15 Storeys High
programme.desc: Vince has an eventful day, running the gauntlet of gangs of youths in the lifts and shopping his elderly neighbour to the local authorities, for feeding pigeons which use his windows as a public toilet. However, when she is evicted, he is overwhelmed with guilt, and he resolves to track her down. Sean Lock stars.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo
programme.desc: The Resistance plan to steal a plane to fly the airmen back to Britain. A parade of antique vehicles is arranged as a diversion, while Rene works on an unusual means of launching the aircraft.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo
programme.desc: Rene and the gang are roped into helping dig a tunnel from the mortuary to the PoW quarters, but end up trapped inside the camp - disguised as British inmates - when their hard work collapses behind them. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A nagging toothache forces a reluctant Del to visit the dentist, but he gets more than he bargained for when the receptionist falls for him and embarks on a Fatal Attraction-style campaign to get her hooks into him. Meanwhile, Cassandra's plan to have a baby takes its toll on Rodney, who has never been so exhausted in all his life. Christmas special from 1993.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A retired jeweller offers Del-Boy the deal of a lifetime - then suddenly has a heart attack and gets taken to hospital with a briefcase containing 250 cut-price gold necklaces still chained to his wrist. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy enters the import trade after striking a deal with Boycie to fetch a consignment of dodgy diamonds across from Holland, and ropes in Rodney and Uncle Albert to help. Their plans are jeopardised when old foe Chief Inspector Slater picks up the Trotters' trail. Feature-length episode of the comedy, guest starring Jim Broadbent, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodney's old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A nagging toothache forces a reluctant Del to visit the dentist, but he gets more than he bargained for when the receptionist falls for him and embarks on a Fatal Attraction-style campaign to get her hooks into him. Meanwhile, Cassandra's plan to have a baby takes its toll on Rodney, who has never been so exhausted in all his life. Christmas special from 1993.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.

programme.title: Extras
programme.desc: Hoping to gain himself greater acting credibility, Andy takes a role in A Month of Summers, a two-hander directed by Ian McKellen. However, he is shocked to discover the specifics of the production's plot. Germaine Greer, Mark Kermode and Mark Lawson guest as themselves.

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy tries to impress Toni with his new job in a music studio, while Mark is disappointed at being passed over for promotion. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg and comedian Hal Cruttenden joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Jack Whitehall, Alex Zane and Ulrika Jonsson join Jimmy Carr on the irreverent panel show. Teams captained by Sean Lock and Jason Manford answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. David Walliams, Reginald D Hunter, Yvette Fielding and Phil Spencer join teams captained by Sean Lock and Jason Manford to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the sci-fi comedy series. After three million years in suspended animation, Dave Lister awakes to find he's the last surviving member of the human race, with only a mutated cat and a hologram of his least favourite crewmate for company. Craig Charles and Chris Barrie star.

programme.title: Suits
programme.desc: Harvey, Louis and Donna search for a link to Sutter's inside trading, Mike goes to extremes to get Kevin on his side and Rachel and Jessica deliver bad news to Leonard Bailey.

programme.title: Flip Men
programme.desc: Mike and Doug discover a supposedly quick job is going to take much longer - when they realise the house they have bought was owned by a hoarder.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The steep streets of Cincinnati's Mount Adams neighbourhood play host to the crazy cart designs, 40,000 people going wild and plenty of crashes.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage from Barcelona of an event where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event from London's Alexandra Palace in which amateur drivers race home-made, engineers vehicles. Over the years, vehicles have ranged from a piano to a giant baby carriage, and the latest contenders include C-17 Roadmaster, Braking Badly, Poldark Express and Turbo Tugboat.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill. This round comes from St Patrick's Hill in Cork as competitors hope their vehicles have what it takes to clinch victory.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a road trip, trying to follow the path of the Three Wise Men across the Middle East. However, they opt to do so in open-top sports cars that were built for significantly less demanding tasks than driving along the conflict-ridden mountains of southern Turkey, through war-ravaged Iraq and across the searing deserts of Syria. The trio also try to find out what myrrh is and where it can be bought.

programme.title: The Dirty Dozen
programme.desc: An uncompromising major is placed in charge of a seemingly suicidal mission to destroy a French chateau being used as a base by Nazi officers. Needing tough but expendable soldiers for the task, he recruits 12 hardened criminals from a military prison. Second World War action adventure, starring Lee Marvin, Telly Savalas, Ernest Borgnine, Charles Bronson and Donald Sutherland.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents an extended edition of the quiz that tests the most obscure parts of contestants' general knowledge, awarding points for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Bill Bailey, Jimmy Carr and Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell to answer fiendish questions on the topic of jargon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedians Milton Jones, Russell Howard and Jack Whitehall and comedienne Holly Walsh join Dara O Briain on the quiz show to offer their opinions on world events in an edition from 2009.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts a 2009 edition of the comedy quiz, as guests Kevin Bridges, Ed Byrne and Chris Addison join panellists Hugh Dennis, Russell Howard and Andy Parsons to offer opinions on world events.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: In an edition first shown in February 2010, Dara O Briain presents highlights from the quiz, as panellists Hugh Dennis, Russell Howard and Andy Parsons offer their take on world events.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Live
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the American comedian.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys watch a TV documentary exploring the history of Thanksgiving, and become convinced that aliens and ghosts were involved in the tale. However, the search for the truth about the first feast threatens to change the celebration for ever.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Kenny's parents are arrested, leaving the put-upon youngster and his siblings at the mercy of the care system. Meanwhile, Cartman is bereft when his orange-hooded friend is taken away from school - mainly because he no longer has a poor classmate to make the butt of his jokes.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys learn the importance of proper bathroom etiquette after Clyde ignores advice and leaves the toilet seat up after use - with devastating consequences.

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Bob finds himself at the centre of a hostage crisis when a thief holds up the bank across the street from his restaurant and the robbery goes awry. Featuring the voices of H Jon Benjamin, Kristen Schaal and Eugene Mirman, with a guest performance by Bill Hader.

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Bob hires an arcade game for the restaurant, and becomes obsessed with getting a higher score than his rival Jimmy Pesto. As his addiction spirals out of control, Louise, Gene and Tina find a new way to entertain themselves - by gatecrashing the birthday parties of complete strangers. Featuring the guest voice of Aziz Ansari (30 Minutes or Less).

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Jake gets close to one of Charlie's girlfriends, but when his uncle declares he will not be seeing her again, the youngster decides to make him suffer. However, a chance encounter with the woman puts Charlie firmly in his place. Meanwhile, Alan and Rose strike up a friendship through Scrabble.

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Charlie is taken aback to learn his former girlfriend Lisa is getting married and resolves to prove he is a better family man than her fiance by organising a Thanksgiving get-together. Comedy, starring Charlie Sheen, Holland Taylor and Angus T Jones. Guest starring Denise Richards.

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Alan is devastated to learn Judith has found a new boyfriend, and begins to wallow in gloom. To help boost his confidence, Charlie and Jake try to give him a makeover, but eventually admit defeat and bring in a gay man to choose the perfect outfit.

programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.

programme.title: The Middle
programme.desc: The Hecks face obstacles as they prepare to drop off Sue and Axl at college, while Brick is worried when Cindy says they should take their relationship to the next level.

programme.title: The Middle
programme.desc: Sue texts Frankie non-stop while she waits for her room-mate to arrive, Axl tries to solve the ant problem at his house, and Brick learns he has a protector at school.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe learns the truth about her father, while a malfunctioning radiator in Monica's apartment goes into overdrive, making her Christmas celebrations steamier than anticipated. Comedy, starring Lisa Kudrow and Courteney Cox.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel meets a man called Russ who bears an uncanny resemblance to Ross, further confusing her already muddled emotions. Meanwhile, Joey discovers he will have to pass an intimate audition on the casting couch to get a part in a daytime soap.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Lesbian Wedding.
programme.desc: Carol and Susan prepare for their wedding, with help from an uncomfortable Ross, while Rachel is shocked by an announcement from her mother - she is getting divorced and plans to go on a voyage of sexual self-discovery. Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer star.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Joey lands a date with a fan, but soon learns she is unhinged. Ross tries to track down Marcel at San Diego Zoo, and Phoebe is hired for a new singing job. Brooke Shields, Chris Isaak and Dan Castellaneta guest star.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rachel tries to fix up Monica with action-movie star Jean-Claude Van Damme, but ends up landing a date with him herself. Meanwhile, Chandler gets his comeuppance for a high-school prank he played on a former classmate. Guest starring Julia Roberts.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Prom Video.
programme.desc: Joey gives Chandler a hideous bracelet as a sign of their friendship, while Rachel insists she has no time for Ross - until Monica's old prom video helps her see him in a different light. Comedy, starring Jennifer Animation, Courteney Cox and David Schwimmer.

programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel - You Know.
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel finally consummate their relationship, and it seems romance is also on the horizon for Monica - but the object of her affections happens to be old enough to be her father. With guest star Tom Selleck.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Moves Out.
programme.desc: Monica's parents are dismayed to discover she is dating their middle-aged friend, and an argument with Chandler prompts Joey to move out of the flat. Matthew Perry and Matt LeBlanc star, with guest appearances by Tom Selleck and Elliott Gould.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys get a little punchy while giving boxing lessons, then head to the mall to share the gift of music with strangers. The loser delivers the right speech to the wrong audience.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys teach a crash course in sorry behaviour, ask strangers to settle bizarre debates and spread good news at the mall. For the loser, a day at the park turns into a mess.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys give a security presentation that is anything but safe, then hold hands with strangers in the park. The loser quickly becomes an unwanted guest at a kid's birthday party.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Moves In.
programme.desc: Rachel begins to feel smothered by Ross's constant attention. Meanwhile, Phoebe makes a video for her song Smellycat, and Chandler's new flatmate Eddie causes problems.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Dr Ramoray Dies.
programme.desc: Joey makes unfortunate comments in an interview with a fanzine, threatening his role as Dr Ramoray and casting a shadow over his acting career. Meanwhile, Chandler's new flatmate Eddie becomes increasingly annoying. Comedy, guest starring Tom Selleck, with Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Won't Go.
