Meanwhile, the girls try to get in touch with their inner selves using a personal empowerment manual for inspiration. Comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc, Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Old Yeller Dies.
programme.desc: Monica's boyfriend makes a good impression on Chandler and Joey. Phoebe gets a shock while watching a film and Rachel begins to resent Ross planning their future. US comedy, starring Courteney Cox, David Schwimmer and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Ross face two bullies at Central Perk. Monica decides to have a flutter on the stock market and Phoebe meets a long-lost family member. Comedy, guest starring Giovanni Ribisi (Avatar).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The pals plan a surprise party for Rachel, but her recently separated mother and father show up. To keep the parents apart, the gang decides to have two different gatherings. Comedy, guest starring Marlo Thomas (That Girl) and Ron Leibman.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe catches chickenpox just as her seafaring boyfriend returns home. Joey gets a job at Chandler's company and Monica becomes obsessed with proving Richard is more neurotic than she is. American comedy, guest starring Charlie Sheen.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Barry and Mindy's Wedding.
programme.desc: Chandler becomes enamoured with a woman he meets on the internet, and the subject of children proves a thorny one for Monica and Richard. Rachel relives the ordeal of her failed wedding day while serving as bridesmaid at her former fiance's ceremony. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston.

programme.title: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective
programme.desc: An eccentric but brilliant former cop sets himself up to champion the underdog - as a private eye specialising in locating missing animals. The zany detective is called in to find a kidnapped dolphin - the mascot of an American football team - and uncovers a plot involving high-level police corruption. Comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Courteney Cox, Sean Young, Tone Loc and Noble Willingham.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Showtime
programme.desc: The popular stand-up entertains 20,000 fans in a show recorded during his 10-night run at the London O2 in 2012. The show features anecdotes about watching his wife get undressed, a horrific trip to the dentist and his children, as well as Michael's thoughts on the Diamond Jubilee, Wimbledon and the Olympics.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Hidden camera practical joke show featuring the escapades of Joe, Sal, Murr and Q from comedy troupe the Tenderloins.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr and Q look back at the series' best punishments and share behind-the-scenes secrets.

programme.title: Amy Schumer Live
programme.desc: American comedian Amy Schumer performs in a live stand-up set.

programme.title: Comedy Central at the Comedy Store
programme.sub-title: Russell Kane at the Comedy Store.
programme.desc: The comedian talks about being married to a northerner, and introduces performances by guests Shappi Khorsandi, Phil Wang and Nish Kumar.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The Bakers, the stars of America's top reality TV show, are rocked by scandal when 13-year-old daughter Lane is discovered to be three months pregnant. Ultra-conservative parents Pam and Frank resist SVU involvement in a misguided attempt to shield their 10 children - and their lucrative TV empire - from disgrace. However, when Lane accuses one of the show's cameramen of raping her, one who happens to have already had a vasectomy, it becomes clear the Bakers are trying to protect someone. Unable to aid in the inquiry due to her own pregnancy, Rollins decides to make good use of her time away from the beat to binge-watch the Bakers' show in an effort to identify potential suspects. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hartigay.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The hunt for a missing teenage girl takes an emotional toll on Sgt Dodds, and DNA evidence becomes the crucial link the team needs to identify the youngster's abductor. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson hopes justice will be served as child abductor Lewis Hodda goes on trial. However, when a plea deal is rejected, Barba must rely on decades-old evidence to make his case, and faces off against former SVU colleague Dr Huang. Crime drama, guest starring Tom Sizemore.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate the death of a senior navy officer on board presidential plane Air Force One. Forensic tests indicate the fatality was due to natural causes, but Abby remains convinced he was murdered. US drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US marine's parachute fails to open during a training exercise and he plunges to his death, leaving the team to determine whether he was murdered. The man had a reputation for good fortune and invariably walked away from accidents unscathed - but his luck at the poker table may have cost him dearly. Mark Harmon and David McCallum star.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A naval commander's body is washed ashore along with the bullet-riddled corpses of two drug traffickers, suggesting he was involved in illicit activities. Gibbs refuses to believe the worst and tries to prove the man's innocence by finding whoever else was involved in the shoot-out. Guest starring Emilie de Ravin (Lost).

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to buy bargains galore at home.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates a role-playing game believed to have caused the death of a sailor who was found at the bottom of the sea in his dress whites. Discovering the dead man was a compulsive player, Gibbs and the crew try to find out how far he would have gone to exact revenge on his arch-enemy, another seaman. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant's mummified body is found 10 years after his disappearance, prompting renewed interest in the case. Declared a deserter, he was given a dishonourable discharge - chiefly because $1million went missing from his ship's safe on the day he vanished. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs, Tony and Kate board an aircraft carrier to investigate the deaths of two crewmen who appear to have overdosed, even though the pair had no history of drug use. At first the inquiry seems doomed to failure - until training tapes offer an unlikely lead. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The partially dissolved body of a submariner is discovered in a tub of acid at a Navy base - but Gibbs discovers no crew members have been reported missing and deduces an imposter has assumed the dead man's identity. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sasha Alexander.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators head for Cuba to look into the mysterious death of a Navy translator stationed at Guantanamo Bay. Discovering a terrorist is plotting to kill one of his own accomplices, they try to thwart the plan before tragedy occurs. Starring Mark Harmon and Sasha Alexander.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is forced to exhume the body of a marine in a bid to ascertain whether a phone call to his widow, allegedly from beyond the grave, was a malicious hoax or evidence that he is still alive. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is buried alive, but manages to claw her way out of the grave. The only thing she remembers is that someone has planted a bomb on board a Navy ship - but in the process of trying to learn her identity, the team discovers things are not as they seem. Sherilyn Fenn (Twin Peaks) guest stars.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A spy satellite technician's voyeuristic activities inadvertently lead to him witnessing the murder of a Navy commander involved in an important weapons project. Tipped off by an anonymous call, the investigators arrive at the base to find the victim has been stabbed in the back. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sasha Alexander.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team races to find a sniper who is targeting marine recruitment officers and picking them off one by one. The only clue is a white feather left at the scene of each shooting - and in the absence of any other evidence, Gibbs uses himself as bait to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sasha Alexander and Michael Weatherly.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Three similar execution-style killings take place, and the team discovers one of the victims was going through a messy divorce. His widow falls under suspicion of committing the first two crimes to mask the murder of her husband - but, unfortunately for the agents, she has an alibi. Starring Michael Weatherly and David McCallum.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs entrusts the team with the task of finding his former commanding officer, who has gone on the run rather than staying behind to face charges of killing a marine and stealing funds. Kate and Tony's investigation leads them to the missing man's cabin - which has been sprayed with bullets and contains an unidentified corpse. Mark Harmon stars.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky, Gerald and Kate are taken hostage by a gunman who demands evidence relating to the recent shooting of a suspected terrorist. As Gibbs and the team struggle to resolve the crisis, they are alarmed to discover there is a Hamas operative in their midst. Crime drama, guest starring Alan Dale (Ugly Betty).

programme.title: White Collar
programme.desc: Neal tries to secure the Pink Panthers' trust by aligning himself with a dangerous enemy from his past. Starring Matthew Bomer.

programme.title: White Collar
programme.desc: Neal is conflicted when the Pink Panthers ask him to con an innocent mark. Meanwhile, Peter works with an Interpol agent whose activities could jeopardise their whole operation.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A music student is raped at gunpoint in her apartment - but although the SVU squad is quick to make an arrest, high-profile defence attorney Bayard Ellis tries to undermine prosecution evidence and damage the victim's credibility. Drama, guest starring Sofia Vassilieva.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Cragen goes undercover when a murder in Brighton Beach leads the team to a thriving mail-order bride business, and hopes to hunt down the killer. Elsewhere, the detectives expose a blackmail scam run by the Russian Mafia. Crime drama, guest starring Timothy Busfield and Izabella Miko.

programme.title: Zombie Shark
programme.desc: Dr Diane Palmer and her Chief of Security Maxwell Cage live to regret experimenting on captured sharks when one is infected with experimental drugs and goes on the rampage. Sci-fi thriller, starring Cassie Steele and Jason London.

programme.title: Fact or Faked: Paranormal Files
programme.desc: The team visits Los Angeles to investigate the legend of the Honey Island swamp monster, and tries to replicate alleged video footage of the creature. The group also heads to Oregon to examine a floating light that has been reported near a bridge, and makes an effort to simulate it using flying discs, balloons and a remote-controlled model aeroplane.

programme.title: Bermuda Tentacles
programme.desc: The US president's plane crashes in the Bermuda Triangle, with the head of state surviving the disaster using an escape pod. A fleet of Navy vessels is sent to recover him, only to discover the crash has awoken a terrifying monster from the ocean depths. Thriller, starring Linda Hamilton and Trevor Donovan.

programme.title: 10.0 Earthquake
programme.desc: A fracking operation causes a series of earthquakes to hit Los Angeles. A scientist realises this is just a build-up to a larger quake that will destroy the whole city. Aided by a repentant fracking engineer, she tries to find a way to divert the seismic activity to an unpopulated area. Disaster movie, starring Cameron Richardson and Henry Ian Cusick.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to buy bargains galore at home.

programme.title: Fact or Faked: Paranormal Files
programme.desc: The team visits Los Angeles to investigate the legend of the Honey Island swamp monster, and tries to replicate alleged video footage of the creature. The group also heads to Oregon to examine a floating light that has been reported near a bridge, and makes an effort to simulate it using flying discs, balloons and a remote-controlled model aeroplane.

programme.title: The Hunters
programme.desc: A couple are secretly part of an organisation charged with recovering magical artefacts. When they go missing on an assignment, their two sons learn the truth, and with the aid of their parents' assistant, must stop a mystical mirror from falling into the wrong hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Alexa PenaVega and Robbie Amell.

programme.title: Under the Mountain
programme.desc: Teenage twins Theo and Rachel have shared a telepathic connection all their lives. After the death of their parents, they go to live with their aunt and uncle, where they discover strange creatures inhabit the town and a mysterious loner with magical powers seeks their help in battling evil forces. Fantasy adventure, with Sam Neill, Tom Cameron and Sophie McBride.

programme.title: Wing Commander
programme.desc: A youthful space pilot resolves to put his troubled past behind him when he is assigned to an elite squadron aiming to protect the human race from feline alien foes. He faces an uphill struggle to prove his daring is matched by his talent. Sci-fi adventure based on the computer game, starring Freddie Prinze Jr, Matthew Lillard, Saffron Burrows and Tcheky Karyo.

programme.title: The Land That Time Forgot
programme.desc: A Caribbean cruise ship is left shipwrecked by a mysterious storm and the survivors find themselves stranded on an island inhabited by dinosaurs and a host of other deadly prehistoric creatures. Fantasy adventure, directed by and starring C Thomas Howell. With Timothy Bottoms, Lindsey McKeon and Darren Dalton.

programme.title: Dark Matter
programme.desc: The crew must pull off a dangerous operation inside the headquarters of Dwarf Star Technologies in a desperate bid to save their ailing leader.

programme.title: Star Trek: Insurrection
programme.desc: Captain Picard and the Enterprise crew uncover a conspiracy by their own superiors and a sinister alien race to take over a peaceful world and exploit its power to prolong life. However, the crew is forced to defy Federation orders and turns renegade to protect the planet's inhabitants. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Patrick Stewart, F Murray Abraham, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner and Michael Dorn.

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
programme.desc: CBeebies contributes to the BBC's Shakespeare Festival 2016 with a special performance of the bard's magical play, tailored to pre-school audiences. Swashbuckle's Cook and Line (Joseph Elliott and Richard David-Caine) swap swabbing the deck for treading the boards as a pair of stage-hands helping William Shakespeare put on his play. Josette Simon and Roger Griffiths preside as Titania and Oberon, Queen and King of the Fairies, while Mr Tumble star Justin Fletcher clowns around as Bottom the Weaver, the star of the play-within-a-play. (CBeebies/tvguide.co.uk)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: The police find Belle's phone near a homeless shelter - but a body is also discovered nearby. Lisa is disgusted to discover why Zak failed to answer Belle's call, and warns him that she will never forgive him if their daughter is dead. Emma gets the wrong idea when she overhears Moira talking about HIV, and Rhona becomes jealous when Pierce and Carly decide to train together for a triathlon.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail reckons Nick has taken leave of his senses when he announces that he and Leanne are back together. Meanwhile, Gary tries to get to the root of Bethany's problems, and Vinny realises that Phelan plans to use Eileen to get his development money.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve sweats as Leanne is forced to announce her pregnancy, Sarah is gutted to discover Bethany has failed three exams, and Lauren pushes the teenager to breaking point. Meanwhile, Eva quizzes Maria about her breakup with Luke, and Eileen tells Phelan that Jason has come to a decision about investing in his development project.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.

programme.title: What a Girl Wants
programme.desc: An American teenager discovers the father she has never met is an English aristocrat, and travels to London to meet him. However, she faces the same disapproval from his family that her mother suffered, and her arrival raises a scandal that threatens his political career. Comedy, starring Amanda Bynes, Colin Firth, Kelly Preston, Anna Chancellor and Jonathan Pryce.

Comedy, starring Hilary Duff, Chad Michael Murray, Jennifer Coolidge and Dan Byrd.

programme.title: The Xtra Factor
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of The X Factor, featuring news, backstage gossip and interviews with the judges and contestants.

programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
programme.desc: A gifted teenager investigates the secrets hidden in his dead parents's past, leading him to a mysterious corporation and an incident that imbues him with superhuman powers. A personal tragedy drives him to use his new-found abilities to fight crime, and he is soon drawn into a deadly battle against a former colleague of his father, who has undergone a devastating transformation of his own. Superhero adventure reboot, starring Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: An angry Stewie replaces Brian with a super-intelligent robot named Lyle, while Lois insists on replacing the mattress thanks to years of damage from Peter's heavy frame.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Chris attend a fat camp, where they encounter a serial killer who targets overweight children, and Stewie becomes terrified of the robot on the cover of Queen album News of the World.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Brian and Quagmire are left to rediscover their own identities when they wake up following a seemingly innocent boys' night out to find their memories have been erased and Quahog is deserted.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Tom Tucker: The Man and His Dream.
programme.desc: Peter becomes newsreader Tom Tucker's agent as he pursues his dream of becoming a famous actor, and Chris begins dating a girl who looks a lot like a member of the Griffin household.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve's book makes him famous, leading Stan to become a horrendously pushy `stage parent'. Acquiring an agent, the teenager leaves his family for a life of luxury. Comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine fakes an affair to impress the glamorous Ladybugs, but finds they are not the kind of people she wants to be associated with. Stan, however, is happier with his new companion. American animated comedy, with the voices of Wendy Schaal and Seth MacFarlane.

programme.title: Bordertown
programme.desc: Gert becomes obsessed with buying accessories for her expensive new doll, forcing Janice to get a job as Ernesto's housekeeper to pay for them.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg starts a relationship with oversexed neighbour Quagmire after celebrating her 18th birthday, but Peter stops at nothing to end his daughter's fledgling romance.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Part one of two. Stan makes a complete mess of arranging a party for his boss - who responds by sending him to Saudi Arabia, where he and the family get an unwelcome taste of life overseas. American and Arabian social customs soon prove incompatible, and a gender war looms. With the voice of Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Part two of two. Stan begins to enjoy the power of living in a patriarchal culture, but the rest of the family members find it harder to become accustomed to Saudi Arabian life. Francine in particular struggles to adjust, and lands herself in trouble by staging a musical protest about gender roles.

A personal tragedy drives him to use his new-found abilities to fight crime, and he is soon drawn into a deadly battle against a former colleague of his father, who has undergone a devastating transformation of his own. Superhero adventure reboot, starring Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: An angry Stewie replaces Brian with a super-intelligent robot named Lyle, while Lois insists on replacing the mattress thanks to years of damage from Peter's heavy frame.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Chris attend a fat camp, where they encounter a serial killer who targets overweight children, and Stewie becomes terrified of the robot on the cover of Queen album News of the World.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Brian and Quagmire are left to rediscover their own identities when they wake up following a seemingly innocent boys' night out to find their memories have been erased and Quahog is deserted.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Tom Tucker: The Man and His Dream.
programme.desc: Peter becomes newsreader Tom Tucker's agent as he pursues his dream of becoming a famous actor, and Chris begins dating a girl who looks a lot like a member of the Griffin household.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve's book makes him famous, leading Stan to become a horrendously pushy `stage parent'. Acquiring an agent, the teenager leaves his family for a life of luxury. Comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.

programme.title: The Investigator: A British Crime Story
programme.desc: Mark Williams-Thomas nears the end of his investigation into the disappearance of Carole Packman, pondering whether her home could be a crime scene. Thirty years ago, the police conducted a thorough search of the property, but they never dug up the garden, so he and his forensic team search for traces of a body. He also receives a series of letters from Russell in prison making astonishing claims - but what is the truth? With his investigation finally at an end, Mark reveals to Sam what he believes happened to her mother three decades earlier. Last in the series.

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Hill investigates a series of mysterious deaths resembling the various martyrdoms of Christian saints and realises they are being instigated by a shadowy figure who presides over a sinister suicide cult. A local vicar seems the most likely suspect, but his own death rules him out of the investigation - and events culminate in a surprise revelation. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Hill's judgement is called into question by the press, which gleefully seizes on DNA evidence suggesting he may once have unwittingly helped secure the conviction of an innocent man. Finding himself the subject of a media witch-hunt, he experiences a crisis of confidence - which is exacerbated by Alex's decision that she can no longer permit him to work for the police.

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Four homeowners in Nottingham compete for the £1,000 prize. The tours begin at a modern new-build three-storey house, home to a jewellery designer, before heading to a lad's pad in the upstairs of a converted 1960s bungalow. The competitors then rate a red home, before the day ends at a gothic semi-detached property.

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Four Birmingham homeowners rate one another's properties, hoping to win the £1,000 prize. Under inspection are Helen Funge's clutter-free detached home, Matt Price's city-centre pad, David Grainger's medieval-style terrace and Jane Cresdee's eco-friendly home, complete with water-saving toilet. Narrated by Guy Porritt.

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: New tenant Osborne seemingly dies after eating a bowl of Miss Jones' home-made soup, plunging the household into mourning - but Rigsby is the one who ends up being measured for a coffin. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter.

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Movies Now
programme.desc: The latest cinema news, reviews and interviews with the stars.

programme.title: In Loving Memory
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his birthday with a drink - on the day he and Ivy are in the dock at court. Comedy set in an undertakers, starring Thora Hird.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A dangerous ex-con returns to Aidensfield hoping to exact revenge on Merton, the officer who apprehended him, and takes Jenny hostage. Meanwhile, the village is rocked by a spate of car thefts and Vernon organises a charity auction. Drama, starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Paul Brennan.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David plans a surprise party for Karen's 40th birthday, even though she'd rather not bother, and Anna rekindles her romance with Simon now he's returned from Australia a single man once more. Jess is devastated to receive disappointing A level results, meaning she can't get away from home, and newcomers the Morecroft family arrive in Skelthwaite, hoping to shake off their tragic past.

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica travels to Wyoming to attend the funeral of an old friend, but instead finds herself investigating the mysterious death of a man everyone despised. Noah Beery Jr (The Rockford Files) and Stella Stevens (Flamingo Road) guest star.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A huge scandal threatens Bohemia, as Holmes is outwitted by a bewitching woman's blackmail who owns a compromising photograph of a European royal. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett as the brilliant Baker Street sleuth, with David Burke as his trusty companion Dr Watson, guest starring Gayle Hunnicutt.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton organises a search of the moors after a farming couple are reported missing, leaving Jenny and Liz to look after their bemused children. Meanwhile, a reluctant Bernie is taken on a mini break to a country hotel by Vernon - but he grows increasingly dismayed over the plans for a new garage. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, Duncan Bell and Sarah Tansey.

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill becomes unwell after receiving the results of a pregnancy test. Elsewhere, when a baby goes missing, suspicion falls on the parents of a girl admitted with a broken ankle. Meanwhile, Gordon makes a discovery about a diabetic patient that explains his behaviour and, in a dramatic finale, tragedy looms. Daniel Casey guest stars.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stephen is faced with a dilemma when he meets an old flame. Karen and David begin to worry about the whereabouts of Jess, and an elderly patient is distraught when his partner is put into care. Drama following community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town, starring Leslie Ash, Phil Middlemiss and Thomas Craig.

programme.title: In Loving Memory
programme.desc: Ivy aims to be elected as the first female President of the British Undertakers' Association. Comedy, starring Thora Hird.

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby decides to express repentance for his numerous sins, at the urging of his latest lodger, a religious student. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Don Warrington and Frances de la Tour.

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Cash-strapped George knows exactly what he can sell to raise money - but decides not to tell Mildred. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton organises a search of the moors after a farming couple are reported missing, leaving Jenny and Liz to look after their bemused children. Meanwhile, a reluctant Bernie is taken on a mini break to a country hotel by Vernon - but he grows increasingly dismayed over the plans for a new garage. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, Duncan Bell and Sarah Tansey.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica Fletcher assumes the guise of a wealthy widow and checks in at a luxury tropical hotel to help an old friend resolve a crisis. Mystery, guest starring Cyd Charisse.

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective and his team investigate a series of bizarre events in the aftermath of a wedding which boasted a most unusual guest list. It transpires the couple had only met three weeks before the ceremony, and the honeymoon in a luxury hotel ends in a brutal killing. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, with Ronald Hines and Josephine Butler.

programme.title: The Secret Life Of
programme.desc: Martin Clunes narrates a documentary exploring how dogs see, smell and experience the world around them, revealing insights into the behaviour, loyalty and remarkable intuition of man's best friend. The programme follows the development of a Labrador puppy from birth through to her own pregnancy as she trains to be a guide dog for the blind, and also hears personal accounts of canines that have saved lives, helped to rebuild marriages and detected diseases in their owners.

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The evacuation of a central London hospital leads to the discovery of a tragic death. When Brooks and Devlin investigate, a suspect is arrested but the prosecutors (Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman) face an uphill struggle building a case - so they team up with the detectives in a bid to gather more evidence. Patrick Malahide and Bill Paterson co-star.

programme.title: Liverpool 1
programme.desc: The squad investigates a music teacher suspected of child abuse, Pauly rows with Jo when she finds out that Frank is in counselling and Cally's brother has a birthday party.

programme.title: The Investigator: A British Crime Story
programme.desc: Mark Williams-Thomas continues his investigation into the disappearance of Carole Packman, looking deeper into the relationship of her husband Russell and his mistress Patricia. One of Patricia's old boyfriends gives his account of how the couple behaved after the disappearance, and Mark also discovers that five years after, someone claiming to be Carole signed over her half of the family home to Patricia. A handwriting expert helps Mark find answers.

programme.title: Don't Say a Word
programme.desc: A psychiatrist's daughter is kidnapped by criminals who hold her hostage in a bid to obtain information from one of his patients - a woman suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder. The distraught father must use his skills to delve into the troubled woman's mind and retrieve the secret to save his child. Thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Sean Bean, Famke Janssen and Brittany Murphy.

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes.

programme.title: Cycling: Vuelta a Espana
programme.desc: Action from the ninth stage of this year's race, featuring a 165km journey from Cistierna to Alto del Naranco.

programme.title: ITV4 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A rich woman hires Thomas to find her former limo driver, who allegedly stole jewellery from her, but discovers he actually took something far more precious - her son. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck.

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: While holidaying in Fiji, the Chief discovers that an old friend has disappeared - and then vanishes himself.

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: The death of a promising high-school gymnast alerts Quincy to the activities of a shady coach who has been supplying her pupils with more tangible help than just words of encouragement. Jack Klugman stars.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie's schoolteacher girlfriend seeks CI5's assistance to quash a drug-smuggling ring after learning a 14-year-old pupil is involved having used then hidden a discarded firearm. The body count soon increases at an alarming rate as potential witnesses to a crime are killed off by the ruthless gang. Lewis Collins, Martin Shaw and Celia Gregory star.

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: The flying squad foils the hijacking of a security truck before attempting to learn the identity of an informer. Colin Welland guest stars in the hard-hitting police drama, alongside John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: Cycling: Vuelta a Espana
programme.desc: Action from the ninth stage of this year's race, featuring a 165km journey from Cistierna to Alto del Naranco.

programme.title: Tobruk
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell.

programme.title: Tobruk
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell.

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: A fledgling superhero crash-lands on Earth after evacuation from his home planet and is taken in by an elderly couple who raise him as their own. But with adolescence comes a greater understanding of his superhuman powers, leading to his rebirth as a crusader for justice and defender of the American way of life. Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando.

programme.title: Superman

Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando.

programme.title: Police Academy 2: Their First Assignment
programme.desc: America's most inept cops graduate and are let loose on the streets - under the command of an unscrupulous lieutenant whose promotion depends on their failure. Fortunately for him, their unique brand of policing actually leads to an increase in the crime rate. Comedy sequel, starring Steve Guttenberg, Bubba Smith, David Graf and Michael Winslow.

programme.title: Cycling: Vuelta a Espana
programme.desc: Action from the 10th stage of the race, featuring a 186.6km journey from Lugones to Lagos de Covadonga.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell, Brandon, Jarrod, Brandi and Ivy battle it out with the local bidders at an auction in El Monte.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Upland.
programme.desc: A surprise visitor from Texas attends the latest heated round of auctions, which goes badly for the bidders but ends in a spectacular climax.

programme.title: Red Heat
programme.desc: A Russian detective travels to America to oversee the extradition of a Georgian drug baron responsible for supplying cocaine in Moscow. He is teamed up with a hostile Chicago cop, but when their prisoner kills an officer and escapes, they put aside their mutual mistrust to bring him to justice. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Belushi, Peter Boyle, Laurence Fishburne and Ed O'Ross.

programme.title: Bundesliga Football Highlights
programme.desc: Isabella Muller-Reinhardt presents action from the opening round of fixtures in the German top flight, including Bayern Munich v Werder Bremen, Borussia Dortmund v FSV Main 05, and Hertha Berlin v SC Freiburg.

Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Belushi, Peter Boyle, Laurence Fishburne and Ed O'Ross.

programme.title: Red Heat
programme.desc: A Russian detective travels to America to oversee the extradition of a Georgian drug baron responsible for supplying cocaine in Moscow. He is teamed up with a hostile Chicago cop, but when their prisoner kills an officer and escapes, they put aside their mutual mistrust to bring him to justice. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Belushi, Peter Boyle, Laurence Fishburne and Ed O'Ross.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A well-known eccentric contacts the Belgian sleuth when he is haunted by suicidal nightmares. However, he fails to follow Poirot's advice, and is found dead soon afterwards. Drama, starring David Suchet, with Joely Richardson and Mary Tamm.

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: Maggie has no choice but to charge her prime suspect when he reveals information only the killer could have known, but she's not convinced he is the culprit. A brutal death then seems to close the case for good and the detective faces a tough decision. Will she protect her career or expose the truth? Meanwhile, Claire and Daniel's marriage is pushed to breaking point by the return of their neighbour Teresa, and the reappearance of an old face leaves Luke shaken. Crime drama set across two timelines, starring Tamsin Greig, Katherine Kelly and Darren Boyd.

programme.title: Band of Gold
programme.desc: Gina's murder leaves her friends in a predicament, and Carol lures the suspected killer to her bedroom. Powerful drama, starring Cathy Tyson and Geraldine James.

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: When the Mayor retires, Lucia is invited to stand for election on the Tilling council - giving her a taste for power. Prunella Scales stars.

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Georgie is wooed by eccentric aristocrat the Duchess of Sheffield, who mistakes him for the mayor of Tilling, and Quaint Irene's portrait of Mapp appears in all the newspapers. Prunella Scales and Nigel Hawthorne star.

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Stafford becomes Head of Europol, but the position gives him plenty of free time, so the Home Office ask him to tackle corruption within the Metropolitan Police Force.

programme.title: Movies Now
programme.desc: The latest cinema news, reviews and interviews with the stars.

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.desc: The connections between TV dramas, narrated by James Nesbitt.

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert of Huntingdon assumes the mantle of Robin Hood as the re-formed band of outlaws resolves to rescue Marion from Clun. Fantasy drama, starring Jason Connery, with Ray Winstone, Judi Trott and Phil Davis.

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.sub-title: A Case of Coincidence - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Eddie Brannel's protests of innocence urge Masters to go against orders, and as a consequence he learns the true identity of the killer. Drama, with Keith Barron and Ronald Pickup.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The police think an elderly woman is dreaming when she claims someone is moving her belongings, but then she is found murdered and Maigret is called in to investigate. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Two boys kill a police officer and no one wants to give any information about the murderers - until Stafford comes up with a deal for better policing on the estate.

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part One.
programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates' novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Robert is badly wounded in a raid, so the men send for Marian, while the Sheriff of Nottingham tries to prove the identity of the outlaws' leader.

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The new sergeant's arrival could mean radical changes for Greengrass, and everyone is under suspicion when a girl reports a stalker in the village.

programme.title: My Uncle Silas
programme.desc: Edward looks forward to spending his holidays with his uncle and attending his cousin's wedding. Later the two redecorate a hotel, and the owner's wife makes quite an impression. Double bill of the drama based on the tales by HE Bates, starring Albert Finney, Joe Prospero, and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The pipe-smoking detective returns to his home town to investigate an anonymous warning that a crime is about to be committed in St Fiacre's Church. Detective series, starring Michael Gambon.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Captain Hastings is staying with friends when wealthy heiress Mrs Inglethorp is murdered. He calls in Hercule Poirot to help him solve the baffling crime, which has the whole household under suspicion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth, with Hugh Fraser, Pauline Moran, Anthony Calf and Philip Jackson.

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith takes the lead role in Jeff Pope's three-part drama charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in the 1960s. As the series opens, Priscilla White is a Liverpool typist with dreams of escaping the office and becoming a singer. It looks like her chance has come when she meets songwriter Bobby Willis, who claims to be in the music industry - so she's less than impressed to later discover his flash car is hired and he actually works in a bakery. Despite this inauspicious start, Cilla agrees to let him manage her, but will their arrangement still stand after her friends, a local band by the name of the Beatles, help her land an audition with genuine impresario Brian Epstein? Aneurin Barnard, Ed Stoppard and John Henshaw also star.

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Reunited with Bobby, Cilla's confidence returns and she once again dazzles crowds with her vocal talents. The re-emergence of impresario Brian Epstein then propels her career to greater heights, but this is quickly followed by a new low when her first record fails to set the charts alight, despite being written by two local lads called John Lennon and Paul McCartney. Epstein suggests a change of direction, persuading the singer to take a gamble on the ballad Anyone Who Had a Heart, against her future husband's advice. Continuing Jeff Pope's three-part biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in 1960s Liverpool, starring Sheridan Smith, with Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard.

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: It looks like Cilla has put that early botched audition and those disappointing record sales behind her as, following the success of Anyone Who Had a Heart, her new single You're My World becomes her second number one. However, while she may have conquered the UK charts, can she follow in the footsteps of her old mates the Beatles and crack America? The signs aren't looking good, and just to add to the pressure, her relationship with Bobby is becoming increasingly tumultuous. But as her manager Brian Epstein's private life starts to spiral out of control, it seems there could be an even bigger threat to Cilla's new-found success. The concluding instalment of Jeff Pope's biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame, starring Sheridan Smith, Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show USA
programme.desc: The host takes his successful talk show stateside, where he invites American guests to air their differences, and dispenses his own judgment on the situation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Lydia from London picks three blind dates from five potential partners, based entirely on the menus they have put together. Having dined with each of them, she then decides who she would like to see again. Narrated by Charlotte Hudson.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Rob from Essex chooses three blind dates from a selection of five potential partners, based entirely on menus they have created.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Malcolm from Gloucester chooses three blind dates from a selection of five potential partners, based entirely on menus they have created.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Sara from Port Talbot, south Wales, is given five menus, each put together by a potential blind date. The five men behind the menus have all come up with a three course meal but Sara will only be having dinner with three of them. She chooses her dates based on the menus she most likes the look of. When the dinners have been eaten and the dates are done, who will she want to see for seconds?.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, Made in Chelsea star Andy Jordan chooses three ladies to date based on the menus he most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Made in Chelsea star Ashley James chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Geordie Shore star Ricci Guarnaccio chooses three ladies to date based on the menus he most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Emmerdale star Gemma Oaten chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Big Brother winner Josie Gibson chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again.

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, TV presenter Matt Johnson chooses three ladies to date based on the menus he most likes the look of.

programme.title: Buying and Selling
programme.desc: Jonathan and Drew Scott help Gus and Denise, whose three-bedroom home is bursting at the seams and means they are desperate to find a new property that suits their growing needs.

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County
programme.desc: The women travel to Napa Valley to celebrate the launch of Heather's new sparkling wine, while Shannon continues to struggle with her emotions regarding David's affair.

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County
programme.desc: Vicki and Brooks consider unconventional cancer treatments, Meghan puts the final touches to her first OC charity event, and Shannon receives shocking news.

programme.title: Married to Medicine
programme.desc: Mariah prepares for a traditional Deshi meal with the women, but Kari and Toya decide to skip the dinner when they discover a bombshell about Quad's past.

programme.title: Mob Wives
programme.sub-title: Mob Wives: Trust No One: Storm A-Brewin'.
programme.desc: Karen uncovers some disturbing information about her boyfriend, Storm, that causes her to question their relationship, while Drita meets the newest addition to Ang's family.

programme.title: Essex Boys: Retribution
programme.desc: The aftermath of the notorious murder of three successful drug dealers proves to have far-reaching consequences. Years later, ambitious young criminals look to make their own mark on the underworld, while others seek revenge for the killing, setting in motion a brutal cycle of gangland violence. Crime drama sequel, starring Alex Esmail and Ian Virgo.

programme.title: Noel Fielding's Luxury Comedy
programme.desc: Noel discovers Andy Warhol is a fake, Tony Reason is visited by an old friend, and the jungle is terrorised by a giant tiger with an STD. A mix of live action and animated comedy, featuring music by Kasabian's Sergio Pizzorno.

programme.title: Drop the Dead Donkey
programme.desc: George considers going to Australia with Sue, Henry quits his late-night show, Joy learns her art may not be as valuable as first thought, and Gus meets Sir Position in person.

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: A funky American preacher sues Desmond for a cut he had two years ago, not to mention the two years of mental distress he suffered as a result.

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: An old flame of Porkpie's turns up out of the blue while his fiancee is away. Barbershop comedy, starring Norman Beaton.

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: Lee falls in love with a beautiful and talented aromatherapist. Barbershop comedy, starring Norman Beaton.

programme.title: Food Junkies
programme.desc: John Quilter prepares a gourmet macaroni cheese, and cab driver Joey Bone samples three full English breakfasts. Plus, a person famous for their jerk chicken.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on debates about the issues behind the headlines.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on debates about the issues behind the headlines.

programme.title: Time Bandits: Live
programme.desc: Live performances from various London venues.

programme.title: The Early Bird
programme.desc: A gormless but plucky milkman causes mayhem at a family-run dairy with his well-meaning ineptitude. He gets the chance to prove himself a hero when he strives to protect the company from being taken over by a larger firm. Slapstick comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Richard Vernon, John Le Mesurier and Peter Jeffrey.

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital.

programme.title: Diana: The People's Princess
programme.desc: The life of Diana, Princess of Wales, which was cut short so regrettably in a car crash in 1997. Friends and former colleagues offer an insight into her true personality.

programme.title: Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Musical comedy chronicling the adventures of a brother-and-sister dance team performing in London at the time of the then Princess Elizabeth's wedding. Starring Fred Astaire, Jane Powell, Peter Lawford and Keenan Wynn.

programme.title: Martha, Meet Frank, Daniel and Laurence
programme.desc: An American woman crosses the Atlantic to start a new life in London, where three friends promptly fall in love with her. Romantic comedy, starring Monica Potter, Joseph Fiennes, Rufus Sewell and Tom Hollander.

programme.title: Notting Hill Carnival
programme.desc: All the colour, music, costumes and atmosphere as hundreds of thousands gather for Europe's biggest parade and street party.

programme.title: Enigma
programme.desc: At Bletchley Park, a brilliant mathematician races against time to crack the latest cipher used by Germany to send encoded messages through its Enigma machine. During the assignment, he falls for a female colleague, but later fears he may have been confiding in a traitor to the Allied cause. Second World War romantic thriller, based on the bestseller by Robert Harris, with Dougray Scott, Saffron Burrows and Kate Winslet.

programme.title: The Notorious Kray Twins
programme.desc: East End gangster Reggie Kray speaks from his deathbed in his final interview, discussing a long life of violent crime and imprisonment.

programme.title: Essex Boys: Retribution
programme.desc: The aftermath of the notorious murder of three successful drug dealers proves to have far-reaching consequences. Years later, ambitious young criminals look to make their own mark on the underworld, while others seek revenge for the killing, setting in motion a brutal cycle of gangland violence. Crime drama sequel, starring Alex Esmail and Ian Virgo.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates. Last in the series.

programme.title: Outback Rangers
programme.desc: The team checks the popular waterfalls are free from crocodiles. The lives of armed rangers at Kakadu National Park in the Northern Territory, Australia.

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Girl Who Talked to Dolphins
programme.desc: Documentary exploring an attempt to teach a dolphin to understand English. In the 1960s, a scientist flooded a house and invited a young woman to live there full time with the animal in the hope that the creature would be able to communicate with her. Featuring contributions from those involved in the experiment, who are speaking about events for the first time.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Battle of Britain
programme.desc: Actor Ewan McGregor and his RAF pilot brother Colin look back on the pivotal Second World War battle, and meet brave souls who helped repel the Nazi Luftwaffe's relentless attacks.

programme.title: The Treasures of Ancient Rome
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke reveals how the Romans' obsession with sex and violence was reflected in their art, and dons a wetsuit to visit the remains of emperor Claudius's pleasure palace. He also examines the bombastic pieces the Republic has become renowned for, including monumental arches and columns whose imagery relays the story of glorious military victories. Plus, the story of the emperor Hadrian, who redesigned the Pantheon in Rome.

programme.title: Britain in Motion
programme.desc: Russ Malkin explores the manufacture of British utility vehicles. Plus, he investigates the history of manufacturing the vehicles and what the future holds.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Three members of the public find out how they are related to key individuals who helped Admiral Nelson in his defeat of Napoleon's fleet at Trafalgar in October 1805. Presented by Chris Hollins.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Lucy Scott, explorer Robert Falcon Scott's great-granddaughter, learns about the appalling conditions her ancestor would have faced in the Antarctic during the winter of 1912 during his bid to become the first man to reach the South Pole. Presented by Chris Hollins.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: The descendants of three soldiers who served during the First World War learn about their relatives' roles in the Christmas truce of 1914. Presented by Chrs Hollins.

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective.

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower.

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Michael begins the third leg of his journey in the mineral-rich state of Minas Gerais, where he learns about the Brazilian mining industry and meets some of the people dedicated to overturning the environmental damage it causes. He then heads to Rio de Janeiro, focus of the next Olympics, where the authorities are ridding the streets of violent drug gangs that have controlled the city's shanty towns. On a lighter note, the globe-trotting broadcaster also learns to celebrate a goal like a well-known radio commentator and visits a `love hotel'.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the animal life of Manaus, Brazil. Timid pied tamarins struggle to find food in the urban jungle, while confident squirrel monkeys roam in gangs.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary examining sloths in Manaus. Wildlife experts must find out why the slow-moving creatures are swapping their jungle homes for the city streets before any get hurt.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Observing the dolphins and manatees that inhabit the rivers around Manaus. While the former have adapted to human fishing habits, the latter are struggling to survive.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the wild cats that frequently head into Manaus. The jungle city's wildlife experts must come to the rescue when jaguars, pumas, ocelots and margays are spotted.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: A look at the vultures that flock to Manaus, and how an increase in collisions with planes means that specialists must find out what is drawing them into the city.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying caimans in Manaus, Brazil. One causes panic after it is spotted on a popular beach, and expert Dr Ronis Da Silveira is called in to investigate.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the large creatures that inhabit Manaus, Brazil. Giant otters patrol the waterways, anacondas come into the suburbs, and large insects appear at night.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the ants of Manaus, Brazil. Several species of the thriving insect cover the urban jungle, but it is the leafcutters that rule.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the many reptiles of Manaus, Brazil. The city employs specialists to manage the cold-blooded creatures.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the most unusual animals that live in the city of Manaus, Brazil, such as rodents, birds, and the intriguing white-faced saki.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the smallest animals that live in the jungle city of Manaus, Brazil, including spiders, scorpions and mosquitoes.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the waterways of Manaus. People share the Rio Negro with exotic animals and tropical fish - one of which, the pirarucu - can reach lengths of three metres.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus

programme.desc: Alastair Sooke charts the decline and fall of the Roman Empire through some of its hidden and most magical artistic treasures. Sooke discovers glorious mosaics that have never been filmed before, but also finds evidence of shocking neglect of Libya's Roman heritage under the Gaddafi regime.
