programme.desc: Jacqueline goes in search of two dresses of different styles for her wedding, while Christina arrives for her second fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cynthia's veil clashes with her dress, causing mayhem, while Passant is running out of time with a limited selection of outfits.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Second-time bride Becky hunts for a dress to make up for her disastrous first wedding, while Monica prepares to wed - four years after buying her gown.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.sub-title: Zach and Tori Tie the Knot.
programme.desc: The family rallies round to get ready for Zach and Tori's wedding - but a storm threatens to ruin the big day.

programme.title: I Am Jazz
programme.desc: The teenager appears on a radio show, but has to contend with abusive callers. She also attends a transgender support group and hears the details of a friend's transition.

programme.title: Undressed
programme.desc: Two single parents try to hit it off, while another man hopes to impress his date with some terrible jokes.

programme.title: Undressed
programme.desc: Two people with a love of sport are paired up, and so are two very intelligent strangers.

programme.title: Sex Sent Me to the ER
programme.desc: A mechanical bull gives its riders electric shocks, and a snowboarder suffers abdominal pain that may require drastic treatment.

programme.title: Trailblazers
programme.desc: A fascinating musical journey examining the development of the back-to-basics movement that emerged in the south of England in the 1970s.

programme.title: Sky Comedy Shorts
programme.desc: One-off sitcoms on an Irish theme.

programme.title: Sky Comedy Shorts
programme.desc: One-off sitcoms on an Irish theme.

programme.title: Beat Beat Beat
programme.desc: Guitar legend Jimi Hendrix performs a selection of his hits on the 1960s West German pop show.

programme.title: Isabel
programme.desc: King Henry falls ill and arranges to meet his half-sister Isabel for the first time in years in a desperate bid to strike a deal that will ensure the future of the realm. A turn of events paralyses negotiations and depresses Henry, causing him to flee to Madrid, leaving Castile to crown a new queen. Epic Spanish drama, starring Michelle Jenner. Last in the series.

programme.title: First Love
programme.desc: Actress Sophie Winkleman tries to rediscover her passion for opera, and receives expert training from English National Opera soprano Sarah Tynan before performing an aria from La Boheme at London's Little Opera House. Last in the series.

programme.title: In Confidence
programme.desc: Laurie Taylor interviews broadcaster, writer and aristocrat Lucinda Lambton. She discusses her turbulent upbringing, including her mother's affair with artist Lucian Freud and a 1973 scandal in which a newspaper revealed that her father, the Conservative MP Lord Lambton, had been liaising with prostitutes.

programme.title: Inside the Actors Studio
programme.sub-title: Inside the Actors Studio: Jason Bateman.
programme.desc: James Lipton interviews Jason Bateman, star of critically acclaimed sitcom Arrested Development, about his life and career, including his time as a child actor in Little House on the Prairie, Silver Spoons and Valerie.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A man risks everything for money when he agrees to kill a former classmate. Starring Bryan Marshall, George Sewell and Charles Keating.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A man with a remarkable memory plans to turn his talent into cash by offering to help someone recall a locker number. Starring Bernard Cribbins, Colin Blakely and Judy Geeson.

programme.title: Katherine Jenkins Featuring Collabro
programme.desc: A performance by the mezzo and the boy band recorded at Cadogan Hall, London.

programme.title: Celtic Woman Destiny: Live In Concert
Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A near-bankrupt hotel owner goes to great lengths to get her hands on an inheritance from a rich aunt. Starring Hayley Mills, Stuart Wilson and Phyllida Law.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A man has an unpleasant shock when he learns his recently deceased father owed a large amount of money. Starring Evelyn Laye, Richard Pearson, Hugh Fraser and David Webb.

programme.title: Portrait Artist of the Year
programme.desc: Joan Bakewell and Frank Skinner head to Dublin for the final heat of the competition, with 12 artists attempting to impress the judges by capturing the likenesses of actor Colm Meaney, Neil Hannon of the Divine Comedy and singer-songwriter and violinist Sharon Corr.

programme.title: The South Bank Show Originals
programme.desc: Melvyn Bragg looks back on his revealing 1992 meeting with actor, producer and director Richard Attenborough, won two Academy Awards for Gandhi in 1983.

programme.title: The South Bank Show Originals
programme.desc: Melvyn Bragg reflects on his 1990 meeting with film-maker Alan Parker, director of movies including Bugsy Malone, Fame, Midnight Express, Birdy, Angel Heart and The Commitments.

programme.title: Hollywood: Singing and Dancing
programme.desc: Stars of stage and screen continue to look back at the film musicals made during the turbulent decade of the 1960s, reflecting on how rock 'n' roll was embraced.

programme.title: Michael Jackson: The Life of an Icon
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of the pop singer, from his early career with the Jackson 5 to his rise to solo stardom and his death in 2009. Family and friends share their memories of the singer, including a rare interview with his mother Katherine Jackson, who discusses Michael's upbringing and his relationship with his father.

programme.title: BST Hyde Park Concerts 2016
programme.desc: Highlights of the British Summer Time events from July, featuring performances by Florence and the Machine, Take That, Mumford & Sons, Carole King and Stevie Wonder.

programme.title: Live from the Artists Den
programme.desc: Grammy and Oscar-winning singer-songwriter Adele performs for a small group of fans at the Santa Monica Bay Woman's Club in California. Featuring hits including Rolling in the Deep and Someone Like You from her album 21 and Chasing Pavements from her debut release 19, as well as a cover of the soul classic (You Make Me Feel Like) A Natural Woman.

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A profile of the actress, who rose to fame with her roles in The Adventures of Robin Hood and Gone with the Wind and won Oscars for To Each His Own and The Heiress.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A troubled young woman's father is killed three weeks after the death of her mother, leaving the priest to console the bereaved while trying to solve a puzzling murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An air stewardess makes her last flight when she is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and his colleagues are called to a neighbouring private island whose property developer owner has been shot dead at a family gathering. Five people are in the frame - the victim's housekeeper, his PA and his three children - although when an approaching hurricane strands the cops on the island, knocking out the phones and computers, they are forced to rely on good old-fashioned investigative techniques. As evening approaches, the cops realise they will be spending the night in a house with a killer. Can they solve the mystery before he or she strikes again? Jimmy Akingbola (Holby's Antoine Malick) and Nikki Amuka-Bird (Luther) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Goodman is called in to investigate the death of former surgeon Emma Redding at a retirement home. With an empty packet of sleeping pills beside her body and her room locked from the inside, it looks like an open-and-shut case of suicide. However, the team discovers everything is not as it seems and mounting evidence suggests she may in fact have been poisoned. Then, a blast from Humphrey's past arrives unexpectedly on the island, and looks set to distract him from solving the case. Guest starring Rupert Vansittart, Joanna David, Phil Davis and Michele Dotrice.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard Poole meets up with a group of old university friends who have arrived on the island for a reunion, only for tragedy to strike when the man who has solved so many murders becomes the victim. Faced with such a sensitive crime, the commissioner quickly drafts in another British inspector to help the team get to the bottom of the mystery. It soon becomes clear that the newcomer, Humphrey Goodman, is just as eccentric as Poole - but he is also just as bright, and wastes no time questioning the partygoers, all of whom are prime suspects, while pondering the biggest mystery of all - how did the culprit commit the crime in full view of all the other guests? Kris Marshall joins the cast, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and the team are called upon to investigate the death of Fidel's old school friend, Carlton Paris, who has been shot at home. The victim was last seen alive at an art gallery with Dorothy Foster, a wealthy older woman - and before long they discover he made his living as an escort and had left several disgruntled and heartbroken women in his wake, including a local judge and the wife of a club owner. But as the investigation progresses, Fidel struggles to keep his emotions in check, forcing him to confront some long-buried issues. Kris Marshall and Gary Carr star, with guest appearances from Adrian Scarborough, Sharon Small, Tristan Gemmill and Josette Simon.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An air stewardess makes her last flight when she is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.

However, the team discovers everything is not as it seems and mounting evidence suggests she may in fact have been poisoned. Then, a blast from Humphrey's past arrives unexpectedly on the island, and looks set to distract him from solving the case. Guest starring Rupert Vansittart, Joanna David, Phil Davis and Michele Dotrice.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A member of staff is found dead at the hospital and Lawson identifies a former morgue attendant who appears to have vanished without a trace as his prime suspect. Meanwhile, preparations for the Anzac Day celebrations are underway, and Blake encounters an old friend who is on the lookout for two deserters. Detective drama, starring Joel Tobeck.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A voodoo priestess who predicted her own murder is found dead in the local school - and while the team thinks her prophecy has come true, Richard is more inclined to believe it is simply an old-fashioned killing. He soon discovers a link to an affair between the school priest and the wife of the headmaster - a scandal that led to a woman's disappearance years before. Caribbean crime drama, starring Ben Miller and Sara Martins, with Mona Hammond, Michael Maloney and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The Edinburgh detective investigates the murder of notorious gangster Morris Cafferty's illegitimate son, as the search goes on to find the person who put Sammy in a life-threatening coma. The hunt for the killer is complicated by apparent links to a spate of hate crimes by racist extremists in the city centre. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah and James Cosmo.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The couch-potato critics provide running commentary on another selection of TV programmes from the comfort of their sofa, casting their eyes over I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, Stephen Hawking: A Brief History of Mine, and Robbie Williams: One Night at the Palladium. First aired in December 2013.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: Lex clashes with Captain Scott of the National Guard, while inside the cordon, the data recovery centre is under attack. A desperate please from Jana plunges Lex's world into chaos.

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess applies for a job at a new school, but things get awkward when it turns out the headteacher is dating her ex-boyfriend. Schmidt quarantines the roommates when Nick gets a cold.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dating show in which singletons meet up with potential partners at a restaurant, having selected them based solely on an internet photograph. First through the doors is Anna, who has a lengthy list of what she wants from her perfect man, Will her date Liam tick all the boxes? Linguist Louis is struggling to learn the language of love, and within seconds of meeting Adela, his nerves takes hold and silence descends on the table. Meanwhile, Michael and Karina share their experiences of parenthood, and writer Louis seems more concerned with the price of the meal as he meets spiritual barmaid Amber.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Grace is furious with Sienna and wants revenge, while John Paul is stuck in the middle as Myra and Sally continue to argue over him. Jesse catches Celine's eye and she offers to give him a hot stone massage - but it does not go according to plan.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe and Piper vie for Leo's attention, and a troubled teenager befriends Phoebe in the hope of joining the Halliwells. Unfortunately, they do not realise she is under the control of a sorceress who wants her to steal their powers.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The coach makes it back to Spain, where the sun is shining and the group are fighting. Adrenaline-filled, wet and wild trips to a zipline and a waterpark cannot distract the group from its infighting, resulting in a fiery vote.

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Ryder announces that he plans to join the US Navy, but Mel and Joe are unconvinced that he is prepared for military life, and come up with a plan to make him change his mind. Their plot involves Joe pretending to support the youngster's decision by giving him a taste of what to expect during his training, but instead devising a fiendish mock boot camp intended to persuade him the life of a serviceman is not for him. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joe Lawrence.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff feels threatened by Audrey's salary increase, leading to a power struggle between them. Russell is disappointed to learn Liz is dating Todd, and orders Timmy to discover why she has chosen him. Jen and Adam make the most of the situation when a waiter believes they have just got engaged.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Lovers.
programme.desc: Russell takes a holiday cruise, believing he will be surrounded by beautiful women, but finds out there are only old ladies on board. Jeff and Audrey stay in his flat while he is away, and soon get into a quarrel that only finishes when Timmy uses CCTV footage to help resolve their disagreement.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Out There and It Hurts.
programme.desc: Acting on Phoebe's premonitions, the sisters try to stop a mysterious killer from striking again. Meanwhile, Prue uses a truth spell on Andy to find out how he would react to the revelation that she is a witch. Supernatural drama, starring Shannen Doherty and Holly Marie Combs.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: A warlock from the past is released from his curse and tries to steal the sisters' powers with the help of Rex and Hannah, but the resourceful three resurrect one of their ancestors to combat him. Meanwhile, Andy grows increasingly frustrated by Prue's continued involvement with bizarre police investigations.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: A raccoon versus a dustcart and a super-fast Smart car both feature among a selection of comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, plus interviews with the people who created them.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Amusing internet videos, including pranks in New York and a cunning way to help a football team to score.

programme.title: Toy Story Toons
programme.desc: Three short animations featuring Woody, Buzz Lightyear, Jessie and all the other characters from the hugely popular Toy Story films. In Small Fry, Buzz is usurped by a miniature version of himself - Mini Buzz. Then, in Hawaiian Vacation, Bonnie and her family take a winter break in Hawaii without Ken and Barbie. Finally, in Partysaurus Rex, normally cautious Rex throws an over-the-top, bubble-filled bash for the bathroom toys. With the voices of Tom Hanks, Tim Allen and Joan Cusack.

programme.title: Toy Story That Time Forgot
programme.desc: Woody, Buzz and some of the other toys are taken to visit a friend of their new owner Bonnie. They encounter a range of dinosaur action figures, but discover they do not know they are toys. When the leader of the prehistoric monsters decides Buzz and Woody must fight for their lives in a gladiatorial arena, it falls to Trixie the triceratops to save her friends by convincing him of his true nature. Short animated comedy spin-off from the Pixar series, with the voices of Tom Hanks, Tim Allen and Kristen Schaal.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Bad Fish Paradigm.
programme.desc: Sheldon finds himself forced to keep a secret when Penny decides to tell him what happened on her disappointing first date with Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Lunar Excitation.
programme.desc: Raj and Howard register Sheldon with an online dating site hoping to find his perfect female equivalent. Meanwhile, a drunk Penny seduces Leonard, but regrets it the next day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco. Mayim Bialik (Blossom) makes her first appearance on the show.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Robotic Manipulation.
programme.desc: Penny is stunned when Sheldon announces he is about to go on his first-ever date, and is even more surprised to find herself tagging along. Meanwhile, Leonard and Raj take a trip to the hospital after Howard's new robotic arm creates problems.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Wiggly Finger Catalyst.
programme.desc: Raj feels upset about not being in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find a date and introduces him to a girl he can actually talk to. They hit it off, but when it becomes apparent he has been buying her expensive gifts, his friends suspect she is only interested in his wealth.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Flaming Spittoon Acquisition.
programme.desc: Comic-book store owner Stuart asks Amy out on a date, forcing a jealous Sheldon to consider the future of his relationship with her. Meanwhile, the scientists become obsessed with an unusual new card game, and Penny organises a round of Twister. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Date Night Variable.
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. Elsewhere, Raj feels lonely while his best friend is away and ends up interfering with Sheldon's and Leonard's dates. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Tangible Affection Proof.
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny celebrate Valentine's Day, but their evening takes a turn for the worse when the latter's ex-boyfriend proposes to his girlfriend in the same restaurant. Meanwhile, Sheldon enlists the help of his assistant Alex to find the perfect gift for Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Locomotive Manipulation.
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy take a train ride to the Napa Valley with Howard and Bernadette on Valentine's Day, while Leonard and Penny head to the vets when they volunteer to look after Raj's dog. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Indecision Amalgamation.
programme.desc: Raj is racked with guilt when he tries to date Lucy and Emily at the same time, Penny has trouble deciding whether to take a role in a film, and Sheldon struggles to choose between two gaming systems. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Helium Insufficiency.
programme.desc: In the middle of a nationwide shortage of liquid helium, Sheldon and Leonard take desperate measures to obtain the supplies they need in order to prove a scientific theory before a rival team of researchers can beat them to it. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette download a dating app onto Amy's phone in order to find her a new boyfriend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Mystery Date Observation.
programme.desc: Howard and Raj post an online advert to find a new girlfriend for Sheldon. Penny and Bernadette spy on Amy to find out more about her new boyfriend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Valentino Submergence.
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy host a live Valentine's Day episode of Fun with Flags, while Leonard and Penny grapple with getting older. Elsewhere, Howard and Bernadette discover a surprise in their hot tub, and Raj is torn between Emily and a girl her met at the Comic Bookstore. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Joanne overhears Joe speaking to Myra, while Diego tracks down Maria and records a confession, but she has a tempting proposition. Warren offers Darren and Maxine their old space at the garage to run the cab business.

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The tourists attend a mermaid school in Spain and welcome two new travellers to the group as the road trip edges nearer to its end.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Leonard and Sheldon are invited to speak at UC Berkeley, they decide to take a detour and try to meet one of their idols - Star Wars director George Lucas. Meanwhile, Raj and Amy offer to settle a dispute with a game of table tennis. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard finds out that he has a half-brother, Sheldon and Amy have a platonic sleepover, and Penny gets an offer to audition for a Kevin Smith film. American comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Made in Chelsea: South of France
programme.desc: Francis and Olivia grow closer, but Toff worries about seeing them together, Sam tries to convince Tiff he is committed to her and Jess is totally smitten with her new French beau.

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: New series. Famous faces including Joey Essex and Tyger Drew-Honey try to find love with members of the Great British public, arranged by matchmakers Eden Blackman and Nadia Essex.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny share an intimate moment as they recover from a psychological deconstruction by the physicist's mother, an expert in psychiatry and neural sciences. Guest starring Mamma Mia! actress Christine Baranski.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions between Sheldon and Penny reach a new high after a paintballing accident leaves an ugly stain on the awkward physicist's favourite sofa cushion. Meanwhile, romance blossoms between Leslie and Howard. Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Pub landlord Tony is brought in with burnt legs as a result of his barbecue gas cylinder exploding - made slightly worse by the fact he was only wearing boxer shorts at the time. Henry, a 93-year-old war veteran, is rushed in with severe breathing difficulties, and builder Bill was knocked unconscious after falling off his shed. His CT scan reveals he has broken his neck in three places, and he may need surgery to avoid damage to his spinal cord.

programme.title: That's So Last Century
programme.desc: Celebrities including Jimmy Carr, James Corden, Dom Joly, Will Mellor, Vic Reeves and Doc Brown rediscover late-20th-century toys, such as Magic Eye books, Domino Rally, Crossfire, Subbuteo, and the Game Boy, plus some very unusual dolls, and the Omnibot robot butler.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Rhod Gilbert and Sara Pascoe. Countdown regular Susie Dent is assisted in Dictionary Corner by Johnny Vegas, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joey Essex.

programme.title: Hugh's 3 Good Things: Best Bites
programme.desc: Highlights of the series with Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall providing tips to make things easy in the kitchen, as he sets out to show viewers how to achieve the maximum taste with the minimum of fuss.

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Foraging guide John Wright tries to find laver, a type of seaweed most commonly harvested and cooked in Wales, before using it to prepare a dish with bacon and clams.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Elsa and Brian Surridge, who are looking for a retirement home on the Costa Blanca and have a cash budget of £75,000 to spend.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Stockport couple Gillian and Paul Clarke search for a holiday home on Spain's Costa Calida on a budget of £45,000.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at One4 B&B in Cheltenham, where debonair art-dealing host Nick Purchase hopes to prove his that his establishment offers the best value for money. However, things get off to a less-than-ideal start when a life-drawing class leaves one of his guests in a fit of nervous giggles.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Windy Bottom B&B in Maidstone, Kent, where owners Gloria Barnett and Dave Goulding try to impress their guests with a trip to Leeds Castle. However, a proprietor manages to offend one of her rivals, and another is not impressed at being allocated a Versace-themed room.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Jolly Carter pub in Bolton, Greater Manchester, run by Phil and Angie Sutcliffe. Despite a few nerves about the accommodation not measuring up, the room inspections go well, but the guests' verdict on the afternoon's roller disco remains to be seen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Humberstone hosts at the 18-room Alexandra Hotel in Llandudno, where he hopes the scaffolding on the outside of his establishment will not ruin his chances. However, when one of the guests gets locked in a bathroom and there is a slip-up with towels and teabags, it seems he has plenty of other things to worry about.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured on the show reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Andrea Nichols hosts the first night in a week of dinner parties that span Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She welcomes dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell, saleswoman Penny Peklivanas, music producer Tim Lawson and events entertainer Andy Harvey into her garden that has been decked out with straw and stuffed chickens in a bid to win the £1,000 prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kitchenware saleswoman Penny Peklivanas hosts the second party in a competition that spans Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She is confident her grand house will impress her rivals and win her the £1,000 cash prize, but her croissant-based main course is not to everyone's taste.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT analyst and music producer Tim Lawson hosts the third dinner party of the week in the competition taking place across Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire, hoping to impress his diners with ingredients brought back from Morocco. He also offers an urban music education in a bid to claim the £1,000-prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell hosts the fourth dinner party of the competition spanning Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. The guests expect very little from the night, but Nicola hopes to impress Jamaican-born contestant Tim Lawson with her Caribbean-inspired evening.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Andy Harvey hosts the final night of the competition which has visited Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. He decides to pull out all the stops at his Stevenage home, hoping to impress with extravagant food and outrageous entertainment - including a luminous underwater disco. At the end of the evening, his dinner guests reveal their scores before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.

programme.title: The 100 Greatest Musicals
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen concludes the rundown of viewers' favourite musicals, counting down from 50 to number one. Featuring interviews with stars including Scott Baio (Bugsy Malone), Lee Curreri (Fame), Ron Moody (Oliver!) and Susan Sarandon (The Rocky Horror Picture Show), as well as directors, writers and producers including Randal Kleiser (Grease), Rob Marshall (Chicago), Alan Parker (Evita, Fame and Bugsy Malone) and Cameron Mackintosh and Willy Russell (Blood Brothers). Plus, Omar Sharif, Elaine Paige, Michael Ball, Claire Sweeney, Jonathan Wilkes and Miss Piggy are among the contributors who reveal the impact these musicals have had on their lives.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Francis and Karen Shaw, who are hoping to save a castle in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. While the project is a chance to fulfil a childhood dream, the building is a scheduled ancient monument protected by numerous regulations. As their expenses increase and they enter their second year of work, they suffer many setbacks.

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: Celia Sawyer, Alex Proud, Pearl Lowe and Andrew Lamberty compete for a Vulcan aircraft engine table, horror film posters, a taxidermy lion's head and a Rolex trench watch.

programme.title: Million Pound Mega Yachts
programme.desc: Documentary about the Monaco Yacht Show, where over 100 of the largest yachts on the water are up for sale, with billionaire buyers competing to own the most extravagant vessels. The programme follows those who make, buy and work on these craft, including a Soho businessman planning to sail around the world, a broker with 25 years experience looking to sell a £130 million yacht, and a billionaire installing a crystal chandelier in his floating palace.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Pub landlord Tony is brought in with burnt legs as a result of his barbecue gas cylinder exploding - made slightly worse by the fact he was only wearing boxer shorts at the time. Henry, a 93-year-old war veteran, is rushed in with severe breathing difficulties, and builder Bill was knocked unconscious after falling off his shed. His CT scan reveals he has broken his neck in three places, and he may need surgery to avoid damage to his spinal cord.

programme.title: President Trump: Can He Really Win
programme.desc: Matt Frei asks whether the tycoon Donald Trump could actually become US President or if he will be crushed by the opposition, Hillary Clinton. He meets Trump supporters and conflicted Republicans, and considering Trump's derogatory remarks on women, Frei also asks whether the billionaire can really win over the all-significant female vote.

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Noel Fielding, Richard Ayoade, Aisling Bea, Adam Buxton and Rob Beckett are quizzed by Jimmy Carr on the past 100,000 years of history, with topics ranging from science to music, food and drink to crime and punishment, and TV to politics. Jimmy is ably assisted by Big Fat Quiz favourites Jon Snow, the children of Mitchell Brook Primary School and Joey Essex, as well as a whole host of famous question setters.

programme.title: Fresh Meat
programme.desc: The newly non-funded wheelchair rugby team protests against Oregon's presidency, Josie is having an identity crisis and takes the drastic measure of rebranding herself, and Vod decides to retreat to an anarchist commune, with the other two girls tagging along. The boys head to London, where Kingsley feels positive about a potential post at a radio station, JP visits his brother's firm to `collect his job' and Howard tries to familiarise himself with the city before he goes for his interview at the Ordnance Survey.

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minute's most memorable parents, including Lucy as she plans to pursue her goal of returning to professional opera singing two years after the birth of her third child. Kirri and Brendan are looking to recapture their youthful spark following the delivery of their second born. Plus, Detroit-born Shannon and her Yorkshire husband Chris try to combine the best of both worlds as they raise their two children.

programme.title: Grayson Perry: All Man
programme.desc: Turner Prize-winning artist Grayson Perry is not your typical man. As a frock-wearing, mountain-biking father-of-one, he has a unique perspective of the male psyche. In this three-part documentary, he investigates modern masculinity, beginning with the world of cage-fighting, or mixed-martial arts, in North East England. As a self-described `sissy', he has a problem with machismo, but as he spends time with the fighters, many of his prejudices are overturned - especially as he realises the struggles some of these men have faced in trying to live up to these masculine ideals.

programme.title: Wedding Town
programme.desc: Cameras follow brides and grooms who have chosen to marry or renew their vows in Gretna Green, as well as the work of the people trying make each ceremony special. In the opening edition, theatre-lovers Lynn and Roger plans to get hitched hit problems, while local entrepreneur Jackie wants to shake up the village's wedding scene by bringing a bit of Las Vegas magic to proceedings.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty teacher Ashleigh throws the second of the week's parties in Co Durham, she hopes a menu of sophisticated dishes - along with a helping of hearts and love - will help her win the cash prize. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners' genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. He hopes to win the £1,000 prize money by impressing his guests with an evening on his farm, featuring a drinks reception and rustic cuisine. However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. She hopes to impress her guests with a sophisticated French menu including salmon crepes, chicken and posh peas and pear dessert. But having been highly critical of everyone else's food so far, will they now take the chance to get their own back or can she win them round?.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final evening of gatherings in Co Durham sees IT manager David stage a French-themed soiree in the hope of securing the £1,000 prize. However, he soon finds his main challenge is to keep all his guests on friendly terms.

programme.title: Gok's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Gok Wan takes up the reins from Kirstie Allsopp as he reopens the Glasgow shop stocked with furniture that has been sourced for free, transforming the items and then offering them to people to furnish their homes. in the first edition, deli owners Gelsomino and Kristine from St Albans are given a makeover of their dining room and an overhaul of a listless living room.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps a couple Phil and Aud Briars in Melton Mowbray, who have been trying to sell their home for six months. The presenter suggests some work in the house and a change of colour scheme will help them to find a buyer.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help key-workers with modest budgets who want to buy their first homes in London. Civil partners Jo Hendle and Ally Macdonald have high expectations, having rented in Belsize Park, but to make the most of their £200,000 budget they need to move away from the expensive north of the capital to the more affordable south. Meanwhile, Liverpudlian Jennifer Dean hopes that £209,000 will buy her a two-bedroom period property in the south of the capital, with outside space for her cats.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou sets sail on the high seas in a historic boat, the owner of which is seeking £750,000 to fulfil his dream of becoming a well-known children's author. Meanwhile, Lawrence is tasked with selling an original Kerry Darlington painting for a memorable returning client, and Essex girl Lucy needs an urgent loan to pay for her mother's funeral, and seeks to secure the money she requires using a diamond ring that has been in her family for generations.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which the property expert comes to the rescue of people stuck in homes they cannot sell. In the first edition, Phil travels to Waterlooville, Hampshire, where he offers advice to Pauline Ridley who has been trying to sell her three-bed terrace for six months without any luck. He believes her love of purple and pink decor is putting off potential buyers, and he suspects there could be an asbestos problem as well.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Aberdeen to help two sets of house hunters who have relocated to the city for work and need to find family homes quickly. Helen Barr and Brian Clarence moved from Essex while awaiting the arrival of their first child and have been living in rented accommodation, but with baby number two on the way, it's time to find a family home. However, Brian's main priority seems to be finding a bargain, while Helen doesn't want to take on a project. Meanwhile, Kirstie helps Kirsten and Scott Laing search for a semi-rural property so they can move their family up from Fife.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bristol, furniture salesman Richard, teacher Anne, paramedic Harriet and IT architect Steve try to outdo each other by throwing the perfect dinner party. As the week progresses, Anne barks at Harriet and recites erotica, while Harriet's ditsy one-liners are a constant amusement for the table. The host on the final night has just one aim - to beat Richard after his restaurant quality meal on night one. In an episode of extreme highs and ravaging lows, expectations are crushed, hidden depths are revealed and criticisms are levelled as the quartet vie for the £1000 prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jeweller Christian Woodall competes against beauty therapist Georgina Smith, cattle farmer Jennifer Brack and moon-walking Liam Gallagher impersonator Paul Wigfield for the £1,000 prize, as the dinner-party challenge heads to Walsall. The week sees meat feasts and animal-free meals, as well as a flurry of arguments and insults - before the hosts put aside their differences to revel in their shared love of an old Oasis hit.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: George Clarke's Amazing Builds by the Sea.
programme.desc: The presenter looks back at some of his favourite builds by the sea, including a multifunctional beach hut in Bournemouth, Dorset, built for less than £400, and a 21st-century update of a Victorian bathing machine in Margate, Kent. George also looks back at some of his favourite waterside retreats in Germany - an extraordinary life guard tower and a holiday home with incredible views across the water - as well as reflecting on the seaside build he undertook with master craftsman Will Hardie that pushed the humble beach hut to its limits by making it float in the open sea.

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: People who risk ruining their own lives for the sake of a night out, including a professional footballer almost triple the legal drink drive limit while on his way to training after drinking heavily the night before. In Crewe, PCs Vicky Howell and Greg Greaves get an eyeful on their Saturday night patrol as they stop a man walking along a main road, naked from the waist down. He doesn't know where his trousers are and it's down to the police to make sure he gets home safely.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels to the El Greco restaurant in Austin, Texas, where the owners have resorted to using a microwave to prepare their `authentic' Greek dishes. Gordon faces the difficult task of uniting a squabbling family before tackling the bigger problem of a business on the brink of collapse.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First up is 24-year-old Rebecca, a singer from Nottinghamshire who is tired of always having her heart broken by guys with a bad boy image and wants to see if choosing a date in the studio can help her pick a better mate. Next up is 25-year-old development manager Dan from Durham, who has unsuccessfully tried countless dating apps and hopes to find Mr Right.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a Nascar-inspired motorcycle for the Stewart-Haas racing team, and Paul Jr pitches a line of dog toys to a company based in LA.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew build a custom chopper for Kobalt Tools and Paul Jr gathers the family for a life-changing announcement.

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: Levi is confronted by Amish leaders from around the country about his vanity, while Esther tries to convince Levi to bring John back into the fold.

programme.title: Operation Repo
programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series looking at the high-pressure world of car repossession in California.

programme.title: Operation Repo
programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series looking at the high-pressure world of car repossession in California.

programme.title: Custom My Ride
programme.desc: The West Coast Customs team works on a contractor's lorry for an organisation that supplies affordable housing.

programme.title: American Hot Rod
programme.desc: Part three of four. Tensions run high when the customised engine does not quite fit the Chevy's front end correctly, forcing Boyd Coddington and his team to do some quick thinking.

programme.title: Mystery Hunters
programme.desc: Araya heads off to Gettysburg for the International Ghost Hunters Convention and Christina makes a voodoo doll.

programme.title: Operation Repo

programme.title: Custom My Ride
programme.desc: Rapper Snoop Dogg commissions the West Coast Customs team to transform his old van into a state-of-the-art mobile recording studio.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps families calm their unruly felines, from cats that break up relationships to violent companions that put their owners in hospital. The series begins with an animal that is seemingly trying to destroy its owner's love life.

programme.title: American Chopper: Senior Versus Junior
programme.desc: Paul Jr and Paul Sr have a meeting away from the cameras to discuss their relationship, while OCC finishes a bike for MyPillow and PJD begins a build for a baseball player.

programme.title: American Chopper: Senior Versus Junior
programme.desc: Mikey considers quitting the show, while OCC starts a build that will be shown to the prime minister of Malaysia, and PJD finishes a bike for baseball player Aaron Rowland.

programme.title: Misfit Garage
programme.desc: The Mustang comes back from the paintshop and the guys get to work, but things take a turn for the worst when Soupbone gets white paint on the bonnet.

programme.title: Operation Repo
programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series looking at the high-pressure world of car repossession in California.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: An investigation into the Loch Ness Monster in which extreme angler Jeremy Wade sets out to examine the evidence, review famous sightings and photographs and talk to eyewitnesses, as he researches the real creature that lies behind the myth.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan and Junior join Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman to test if a crab pot would drag someone overboard if their foot was caught in a coil.

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: From raw materials to finished products, how are mass-produced favourites really made? Discover the story behind Red Fusion smoothie, cinnamon rolls, and ice cream.

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: From raw materials to finished products, how are mass-produced favourites really made? Discover the story behind Smarties, Muffin Mix, and tart dried cherries.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A TV producer has trouble feeding the eels in his tank, and the team visits a Malibu winery where a fire caused damage to an outdoor aquarium.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Tensions among the crews mount as Zeke loses his cool and Steve fights for his job.

programme.title: Yukon Men
programme.desc: James calls on his son for help during driftwood logging season, while Stan gets caught in a storm. Also, Charlie's battle with the black bear continues.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz Lee and Eivin travel 160 miles and brave the bears of `Terrible Island' to hunt deer, while Eve helps Charlotte solve a swarming bee problem.

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: From raw materials to finished products, how are mass-produced favourites really made? Discover the story behind mail-order filet mignons, and cheese crackers.

programme.title: Food Factory USA
programme.desc: From raw materials to finished products, how are mass-produced favourites really made? Discover the story behind French fries, frozen pizzas, and Cracker Jack candy.

programme.title: Flipping Ships
programme.desc: Edwin McCain and his crew attempt to turn a pile of junk into a Chinese junk ship, a majestic vessel with multiple masts designed to sail in heavy winds.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The men from Dakota work to reopen their mine, the Hoffmans are held up by a broken excavator, and Parker Schnabel totals up his season's hold before handing the mine back.

programme.title: Yukon Men
programme.desc: The men only have a few days to stock-up on salmon, and race to get the fish wheels ready and set the nets.

programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A reporter for the Navy Times is found stabbed to death - and the team learns he had been going to meet a call girl linked to three other murders. programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The team is called to a wedding reception where the bridegroom's mother has been found dead. The discovery that she was a lawyer working on a controversial case leaves a number of potential suspects, each with a professional grudge - but the car containing all the evidence from the crime scene is later stolen. Starring George Eads and Jorja Fox.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom, Catherine and Brass investigate the murder of a blackjack player killed following a big win. The man was a Ferrari-driving highroller who had already scooped $10,000 earlier that night in a pool game, but the team discovers he was an entertainment tycoon's assistant, only in Las Vegas for an all-expenses paid weekend funded by his wealthy boss.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man accused of murdering his wife and colleagues barricades himself and a hostage in a casino hotel room. His brother, who was recently released from prison, appears to be the key to solving the case, but Brass is forced to negotiate until he can be found. Starring Paul Guilfoyle and Gary Dourdan.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Part two of two. Grissom calls Brass's daughter as the captain fights for his life after being shot in the chest, but she seems unconcerned. Meanwhile, the team tries to focus on investigating the death of a man decapitated on a train track, and is shocked to learn he had a 19in waist. Starring William Petersen, Teal Redmann and Paul Guilfoyle.

programme.desc: The team suspects a desperate marine may have faked his own death with the help of a friend and blown up an ambulance in a botched attempt to cover all traces of the subterfuge. Subsequent developments, including a mysterious disappearance, seem to confirm the hypothesis - until a timely discovery by Abby throws new light on the case.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to a national forest where several women have gone missing and conclude there may be a serial killer at large - a theory confirmed in gruesome fashion as the investigation proceeds. Drama, with Mark Harmon and David McCallum.

programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly.

programme.title: NCIS

Her paranoia seems justified when the girl disappears without trace, and she uncovers the terrible truth about the stranger she allowed into her home. Thriller, starring Ashley Scott and Mekenna Melvin.

Thriller, starring Ashley Scott and Mekenna Melvin.

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A hated businesswoman is found dead under an ice sculpture with her heart completely frozen. The investigators identify liquid nitrogen as the cause and discover a number of suspects among her employees and associates. Meanwhile, a woman's body falls onto the roof of a school bus - and the ensuing investigation leads Mac and Danny to a dangerous new designer drug.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a religious website creator leads Bernard and Lupo to a network of corruption in a charitable foundation that provides the motive for the crime. The case becomes even more complicated when the suspect manages to avoid prosecution by being granted asylum, leaving McCoy fighting for his career.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates when a journalist is found murdered, but the case presents new evidence for an old crime involving a man serving a life sentence for spying for the Chinese government. Keith Carradine guest stars.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a man who was learning how to chat up women at a nightclub, and soon has a long list of suspects. Meanwhile, Horatio tries to help Delko's sister Marisol, who has been arrested on drug charges. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Alana De La Garza star.

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: DB Russell heads to New York to help Mac search for his kidnapped girlfriend Christine, and James Boyd arranges to meet up with the gang to drop off the diamonds and release the hostages. With the CSI team monitoring his every movement, Boyd starts to ask too many questions and the captors begin to suspect he has involved the police. Conclusion of the two-part crossover between the Las Vegas and New York CSI franchises, starring Gary Sinise and Ted Danson.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the private life of a murdered Navy captain whose actions may have led to his death, while McGee finds his ideal woman on the internet - but it turns out she is too good to be true. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray, Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Inquiries into the death of a marine land the team squarely in the middle of an inner-city gang war - and a message found at the scene of the crime seemingly implicates Gibbs. Forced to confront a secret from his past, he calls his mentor Mike Franks for help. Drama, guest starring Muse Watson and Kari Coleman, with Mark Harmon.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Kensi and the team hunt for an electromagnetic pulse device that was stolen from a college research facility, and could destroy Los Angeles if activated, killing millions of people. Elsewhere, Sam is on the lookout for a Christmas present for his daughter. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell, LL Cool J and Daniela Ruah.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The concluding instalment of a two-part crossover with the original NCIS series sees Sebastian joining Abby Sciuto in Washington, DC to pick through the forensic evidence relating to the aircraft murders. Meanwhile, DC agent Ellie Bishop heads to New Orleans to help Pride and his team track down the chief suspect - Abby's brother Luca. Naval crime drama, guest starring Pauley Perrette.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Agents G Callen and Sam Hanna investigate after a naval officer is killed during an LAPD shootout, with two other men who died in the gun battle being identified as members of a Mexican drug cartel. Spin-off drama following the exploits of the Los Angeles-based Office of Special Projects, an elite NCIS division specialising in undercover assignments. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is killed by a bear in what initially appears to have been an accidental encounter - until the team realises he may have been set up as bait. Further investigations suggest his death is linked to the murders of a call girl and her boyfriend, leading to the discovery of an illegal prostitution business that caters for wealthy Miami clients. Drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Drama based on the best-selling books by Henning Mankell, starring Kenneth Branagh as a Swedish detective recently estranged from his wife and struggling to readjust while fighting a rising tide of violence. Inspector Kurt Wallander searches for a link between three apparently motiveless murders, and tries to identify a girl who doused herself in petrol and burned to death. With Sarah Smart and Sadie Shimmin.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Part one of two. A university student who has committed suicide is revealed to be the victim of bullying, and concern grows when a gun is discovered in his locker and a memory card in his stomach is found to contain photographs of his tormentors. The team's fears become a reality when a building comes under attack by a rampaging shooter, leaving Harry and Nikki trapped inside while a helpless Leo is forced to watch on CCTV as the dramatic events unfold. Guest starring Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: The Wonder List with Bill Weir
programme.sub-title: The Everglades: A Fight for Glory.
programme.desc: The American television journalist explores fascinating places around the world, encountering other cultures and wildlife.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits an arch-shaped home made of clay tiles in the Weald of Kent, built by Richard Hawkes, who designed the property, and his wife Sophie. It was intended to be energy self-sufficient and able to supply surplus power to the National Grid, but serious problems occurred when the arch collapsed during construction, so the presenter returns to see if their innovative home has lived up to its promise.

Meanwhile, Mod's new job as a children's entertainer leads to an unexpected meeting with a potential love interest. Jeff Rawle, Celia Imrie and Hywel Bennett guest star.

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.sub-title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Willesden.
programme.desc: When comedian Bunny Hopper (guest star Roy Hudd) collapses and dies on stage, a heart attack seems the probable cause. However, the post-mortem reveals that he had ingested rat poison. Not only was Bunny married, but he had a long list of female friends all over the country with three regular girlfriends in Willesden alone - all of whom were at the club the night he died. With most of the squad away on a special assignment, Dangerous and Mod start interviewing all of the suspects. Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes.

programme.title: The Last Detective

Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes.

programme.desc: A bail enforcement agent is assigned the task of tracking down his own ex-wife, a wily reporter chasing a story about a murder cover-up. However, bringing his former spouse to justice is harder than he anticipated, not least because she has also been targeted by the criminal she is investigating. Action comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Jennifer Aniston, Gio Perez, Joel Garland, Jason Kolotouros and Matt Malloy.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the series in which enthusiastic home cooks take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The first stop on their nationwide tour is the Cotswolds, where judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood challenge them to make their signature cakes and tackle a recipe for Victoria sponge. The week's final task sees them producing a tricky chocolate celebration cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With their numbers reduced from 10 to eight, the enthusiastic home cooks take part in the next stage of the contest, heading for Scone Palace near Perth. Here, they are challenged to bake their signature biscuits, scones and petit fours with meringues, choux pastry and macaroons. The judges are Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Here, they are challenged to bake the perfect loaf, under the watchful eyes of Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The competitors reach the penultimate round of the contest, heading to the Cornish village of Mousehole to test their pastry-making skills. They are challenged to produce their own versions of hearty British classics, while Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins examine the history of pies, detailing their slightly more sinister past.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three remaining contestants head for Fulham Palace in London for the grand final, where they are challenged to use all their skills to recreate the 19th-century tea parties once hosted in the area. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood are joined by former competitors to pass judgement on the items offered, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present the victor with the Bake Off trophy.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Allston, outside of Boston, where two restaurants are sharing one kitchen but preparing totally different menus.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a cafe in Cincinnati which is putting their creative spin on barbecue chicken and vegan chilli.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a restaurant in Boston that is making a variety of Southern staples including chicken, waffles and tater tots.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Jamaican restaurant in Cincinnati, which is serving up its trademark jerk chicken and spicy snapper dishes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a roadside bar in Parkland, serving up sandwiches stuffed with brisket and crispy pork belly.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Cincinnati to visit three restaurants on one street. First up is the pub where a husband and wife duo dish out all kinds of creative hot dogs and sandwiches.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals how to create delicious dishes without spending hours at the stove, preparing a chicken pie and split pea soup.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares raspberry shortcakes.

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares an elegant and formal dessert using gingerbread, as she bakes a gingerbread berry layer cake with lemon frosting.

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: The pastry chef demonstrates how nut cakes can range from the most simple to elaborate grand tortes, and shares a few recipes.

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.desc: The team prepares a Noah's ark cake for a bar mitzvah and an aeroplane cake for the opening of a sky lounge.

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.desc: The team makes a cake for Roger Moore's 80th birthday.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her middle children with a week of food and fun while the others are away, making cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup, chicken alfredo and grilled fruit pizzas.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Just weeks after Hurricane Gustav wreaked havoc on Louisiana, Jamie Oliver visits the state, hoping to understand how food helps to maintain people's spirits through adversity. In New Orleans he calls at a Creole restaurant run by a self-styled gumbo queen, and is given the opportunity to learn the art of alligator hunting.

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Dinner Parties
programme.desc: The cook shows a dinner party host how to create a successful evening. First up is Jonny Lacey, who learns how to prepare a menu of scallops with cabbage, bacon and orange, followed by chicken confit with rosemary potatoes and lentils, and a dessert of blackberry mousse.

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Dinner Parties
programme.desc: Rachel gives keen cook Michele Davies a dinner party masterclass, creating a menu of smoked mackerel and goat's cheese souffle, followed by a main course of roast spiced lamb with spinach and mint orzo and a blueberry and custard tart for dessert.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare two more quick recipes, beginning with sausage gnocchi, warm kale and bean salad, followed by Mexican chicken, wicked mole sauce and vegetables and rice.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Asian Sea Bass and Chorizo Carbonara.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare two quick recipes. On the menu today are Asian sea bass with sticky rice and dressed greens, as well as chorizo carbonara and Catalan market salad.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Running a store isn't easy, and Ina should know - she ran a deli for 20 years. Ina suggests a French-inspired menu of Provencal soup, seafood and coconut madeleines for dessert as a staff thank you.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals her cooking secrets. Ina sends a food lover's delight to a friend in the city. The package consists of a beautiful fillet of beef and a perfect plum tart.

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Theo Randall and Rachel Allen set off on a culinary road trip to compete in cookery contests around the UK, beginning by travelling to Rothesay on the Isle of Bute and putting their quiches up for scrutiny at the Bute Agricultural Society's summer show. The pair also meet oyster farmer Andre Hughes and sample some of his world-renowned produce.

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Theo Randall and Rachel Allen head to Aberfeldy, Perthshire, on the second day of their culinary road trip and visit nearby Heather Hills honey farm to meet beekeeper Mark Noonan. The chefs then set up their kitchen to prepare chocolate sponges for the Atholl and Breadalbane Agricultural Show, where judges Kate Imlay and Jeannie Black decide whether they make the grade.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's raids the pantry, and makes a fragrant chickpea curry with rice, then for sweet treats in a hurry, no-bake peanut butter bars save the day.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's father-in-law, Chuck, is spearheading a big fence fixing project on the ranch, so Ree is saying thank you by delivering him and his crew a Tex-Mex lunch.

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie retreats to Malibu for some much needed R&R with her sister, Hilary, and friends, where they head to the beach to indulge in pizza, wine and a bonfire banana-boat dessert.

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie goes to great lengths to learn the skills of Plan Check burger making. In the end, Haylie rises to the occasion and proves to be a true grillmaster!.

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.desc: The team makes a cake for Roger Moore's 80th birthday.

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.desc: More expert baking from Baltimore as the cake makers replicate a hockey rink and the town's skyline in preparation for customers' forthcoming weddings.

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo samples Korea's finest fish and seafood, from the biggest fish market in Seoul, Noranjin, to the remote clam tents near Busan.

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Judy Joo concocts some of Korea's famous side dishes with a perilla leaf kimchi, doenjang soup with tofu and vegetables and egg custards with shrimp. In Korea, she introduces Korean styles of eating and samples fermented fish.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy's getting an authentic taste from all around the globe like Latin fusion, real-deal Thai, and Sicilian specialties.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy's taste buds are in for a culinary adventure with meaty Texas chili, decadent pumpkin pancakes, peanut butter burgers, 'Bacon Love' ice cream and a mean mole sauce.

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine visits the Dog and Pony Ale House in Renton, where the owner is overwhelmed by a vocal group of customers, trust issues with staff, and a large sum owed in taxes.

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After noticing an excess of lobster meat, Peter, owner of the Roll 'n' Lobster Food Truck in Los Angeles believes his new drivers are using his vehicle for personal errands, so seeks the team's advice.

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Pelons Tex-Mex Restaurant in Austin, Texas contacts Charles for advice after hearing rumours that his staff are collecting money for an unauthorised charity.
